job_description:
JOB
Performs a full range of professional and technical duties in support of the Public Infrastructure Fiscal and Business Administration department assists in activities with mergers, acquisitions, strategic initiatives and other projects and activities requiring financial planning and analysis (FP&A). Builds financial models, prepares project plans and presentations, board documents and other deliverables as assigned. Involved in debt management, compliance and issuance activities for business units within the branch.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Involved in analytical and technical support in business endeavors, debt issuances, operating and capital budgets. Provides key support to merger and acquisition activities, ensures reports are filed and regulatory requirements are met. Performs a wide range of financial planning and analysis (FP&A) work and presents results to management. Assists in the monitoring debt positions of Public Infrastructure funds including financial reporting, accounting, rating agency surveillance, and all associated compliance metrics. Conducts continuing analysis and research on debt positions relative to the market, industry peers and to the unit’s historical trends and coordinates communications with applicable advisors, counsel, and other agencies. Tracks and records regulatory reports, performs fund audits, and reviews financial statements. Creates and implements analytical and decision models, develops procedures, and advises on various transactions. Reviews monthly financials and creates P&L and other related analyses. Monitors fund balances, produces cash flows and P&L statements, and analyzes revenue streams. Reviews end of year financials, corresponds with internal and external audit functions and recommends and executes accounting entries where necessary. Other duties as assigned.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Knowledge of Financial Metrics and Enterprise Fund operations.Knowledge of GASB regulation, Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and Associated Practices (GAAP) utilized in governmental budgeting and cost reduction.Knowledge of automated and financial system(s) in relation to billing, cost accounting, and operation and maintenance.Knowledge of external financing markets, methods and regulations including debt financing.Knowledge of general philosophy, principles and objectives of the operating department or unit.Knowledge of the methods and procedures involved in budget preparation, maintenance and control.Knowledge of principles and methods of data collection, statistical analysis and social research procedures.Knowledge of Florida local government budgeting, auditing and accounting is preferred.Knowledge of computer operations to include Microsoft Office based applications.Ability to utilize Microsoft Excel and perform analyses including the use of pivot tables and formulas.Ability to develop and implement administrative procedures and to evaluate their effectiveness.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with officials, other departments, employees and the public.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
PHYSICAL SKILLS: The ability to communicate effectively using verbal, written or visual communication. Ability to operate computers, phones and general office equipment.EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE: Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree or higher in Public Administration, Business Administration, Finance or Accounting or related field. Two (2) years of experience in a position that involved financial planning and analysis (FP&A) and activities such as budgeting, debt management, statistical analysis, financial statement preparation, etc. Experience in a public sector is preferred.LICENSES, CERTIFICATIONS OR REGISTRATIONS: Must possess a valid Florida driver's license.ADA STATEMENT: A qualified employee or applicant with a disability may be afforded a reasonable accommodation to perform the essential job functions of a position in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act. DRUG-FREE WORKPLACE: Pasco County BOCC is a drug-free workplace in accordance with Federal and Florida Law. EMERGENCY RESPONSE/RECOVERY ACTIVITIES: All employees will be required to work before, during, or after an emergency. During an emergency, employees may temporarily be assigned to work and perform duties outside the normal scope of their position, location and work schedule to fit the needs of the County and its citizens.VETERANS' PREFERENCE: Under Section 295.07, F.S., chapter SSA-7 Pasco County BCC provides to Veterans, that preference in appointment will be given to preference-eligible applicants.PASCO COUNTY WAS VOTED ONE OF THE NATION'S TOP WORK PLACES FOR 2021

job_description:
Healthcare Financial Data Analyst

VillageCare Corporate Office

120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271

VillageCare is seeking an enthusiastic professional for our Full Time Financial Data Analyst role. This position will develop, document, and maintain reports and analytics that inform leadership on key indicators as well as drive financial success. The financial data analyst is responsible to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of routine and ad hoc reports for the team. The financial data analyst will work with internal and external customers and will be accountable for the successful roll-up of reports and customer satisfaction.

Playing a key role in the Financial Department, you will create, document, and automate regulatory reports to the New York State Department of Health and CMS. You will lead the medical claims reinsurance reporting and reconciliation process. You will complete monthly and quarterly provider specific financial statements and reports. Work with provider team and Director to document reporting rules. This position will play an integral role in developing a member economics report to help leadership make business decisions.

We would like to speak to those who have 2-4 years of experience in business intelligence and analytics, performing increasingly complex data analysis and report/dashboard development, in a health care setting. A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance or other relevant field required.

As part of the VillageCare team, you'll enjoy a highly competitive compensation and benefits package, including 403(b) retirement plan and more. VillageCare is an organization that offers a wide range of at-home and community-based services, as well as managed long-term care options that seek to match each individual's needs to help them attain and maintain the greatest level of independent living possible. VillageCare is a Drug-free workplace. Equal Opportunity Employer.

job_description:
Description:
All applicants are required to upload a Cover Letter and Resume

Position purpose: The data analyst supports efforts to build and sustain organizational excellence at Esperanza by using data to keep us aligned with our strategic plan and mission. Working closely with our quality improvement, and clinical & operational teams, this position will support enterprise-wide data needs. This role is part of a growing team at Esperanza and we want people who are creative and can roll up their sleeves to get the job done. Big picture, we want to foster an organizational culture of learning & curiosity around data storytelling at Esperanza, and this position will play a pivotal role in that process.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
Become a subject matter expert with the electronic medical record’s (EMR), and other data sources, reporting abilities. We want to help stakeholders become familiar with what questions we can answer with our data and what types of reporting capabilities we have
Dive in to our electronic medical record, and other data sources, to build reports, troubleshoot reports, export data, review and clean data, and securely share data with stakeholders
Build new and maintain existing Microsoft BI dashboards that we use to help make decisions around clinical quality and operational excellence
Use sound adult learning principles to display data to different stakeholders across the organization so that they understand and get curious about the data. Ultimately, your work will support meaningful decision making that will help us achieve good patient outcomes, improve the patient experience, improve staff satisfaction, and help us make sure we’re stewarding resources efficiently
Take data requests and work with the quality department to set expectations, prioritize needs, and ensure data requests align with our strategic plan
Partner with key stakeholders across the organization to scope their clinical and operational data requirements and create action plans to support these data requirements in alignment with our strategic plan
Partner closely with practice transformation associates and the quality team to support data needs related to quality improvement projects in support of our quality plan
Troubleshoot reporting issues with vendors and keep teams updated on any data changes
Help contribute to and continually improve our policies around data governance and use
Store, archive, and manage data securely and in a way that is easily accessible to other members of the team
Other duties as assigned

Esperanza Health Centers is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) according to Title 44, Ill. Administrative Code, and Subpart C Section 750.150.

PM21

1. Familiarity with the data needs of a primary care clinic

2. Knowledge of medical terminology and standards (e.g., ICD9/10, CPT, etc.)

3. Proficient in writing SQL queries and stored procedures on large data sets with complex data models

4. Data management experience; knowledgeable in database rules, writing queries, and relational database creation and management (create, query, relate)

5. Proficient in Microsoft products, including MS Office Suite, MS Access & MS PowerBI

6. Experience building reports & pulling data from an electronic medical record is required. A bonus if you have experience working in Athena

7. Familiarity with clinical care quality measures (operational and clinical) a bonus

8. Understanding the needs of adult learners preferred

9. Comply with Esperanza’s policies and procedures (e.g., HIPAA & data use)

10. Clear verbal and written communication

11. Strong interpersonal and facilitation skills

12. Demonstrate high attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy

13. Excellent organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills

EDUCATION Bachelors degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalent work experience in Data Analytics, Health Informatics or Business Intelligence.

job_description: Data AnalystABOUT INTRINSIC SCHOOLSIntrinsic Schools is a small charter network in Chicago that is implementing a revolutionary new model for public education that prepares all students for postsecondary success and world-changing endeavors. We started Intrinsic to reimagine the learning experience for middle and high school students based on the beliefs that young people learn best when they collaborate, feel a deep sense of belonging, and set and monitor progress toward individualized goals. Our model systematically teaches students to think, solve, communicate and reflect while also building Empathy, Perseverance, Identity and Curiosity - our EPIC Core Values. We flex time and space in both of our schools, redefine the role of teachers, and use technology in new ways to ensure every student receives tailored instruction, and eventually graduates with their own personalized postsecondary plan that is dedicated to their own interests, goals, and choices.Our approach is focused on the whole child, and can look different than in other public schools - in part because of our dual focus on student gains in academics and personal agency. To support this, we use mastery-based grading in many of core content classes; a weekly Choice Day (C Day) for all students; Student-Led Conferences (SLCs) that connect students, teachers, and families three times each year; and Advisory classes comprised of groups of students who meet daily all four years of high school and essentially grow up together, under the guidance of one four-year advisor. Our school culture deliberately prioritizes student voices and relationships - with each other and with adults - while also having very high expectations of them. To support this work, we rely on restorative practices as well as consequences, when necessary, to ensure a safe and joyful learning environment for all students.Intrinsic currently operates two exceptional public high schools open to all Chicago students. Founded in 2013, our Belmont Campus serves 1,000 students in Grades 7-12 in the Hermosa neighborhood. Our Downtown Campus currently serves 625 students in Grades 9-12 and will serve 1,000 students in Fall 2023. Both schools are public schools, with enrollment that is based solely on an open lottery each spring – no tuition, entrance exams or other selective criteria. Our student demographics across both schools are 90% students of color, 86% free and reduced lunch and 19% students with disabilities.*ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY*Intrinsic Schools has been nationally recognized for its innovative use of technology and data by students and staff. The Data Analyst is highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics and will collaborate with a high performing Tech & Data team to support innovation and growth. Additionally, the ideal candidate is able to transform data into understandable, outcome-oriented reports that support the success of our network. With two schools eventually serving 2000 students, strong data systems are crucial to the success of the organization. With technology and data deeply integrated into the model, this opportunity affords meaningful relationships and deep impact on the students, families, and staff in the entire school community. This position reports to the Director of Special Data Projects of Intrinsic Schools._Objectives of this role: _Implement and maintain leading-edge analytics systems, ensuring timely reporting and submission of data to various stakeholders and 100% data quality and integrityPerform analysis using appropriate statistical techniques on complex data sets to extract meaningful informationEvaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning dataSummarize metrics, produce visualizations, and identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex datasetsWork directly with managers and users to build relationships, gather requirements, and communicate status updates; work directly with principals and provide them analysis around our network priorities_Responsibilities will include but are not limited to: _*Data Analysis & Visualization*Design, build, and iterate tools and processes that help our organization to make equitable decisions (Note: In general, these tools and processes are created in dbt and Looker Studio and will cover student assessment analysis including NWEA MAP, P/SAT, Interim Tests, and AP data)Work directly with school administration and organizational leadership to ensure tools and processes meet the needs of our end-usersTest, validate, and evaluate data visualizations for accuracy, performance, and alignment with organization priorities and determine the best data visualization methods to present informationCollaborate with the Tech & Data Team to scope end-user requirements and project plan for interactive and dynamic data visualizations to meet functional needsContribute to our internal team’s knowledge management systems, documentation practices, and code review process to ensure that we build and maintain infrastructure sustainablyCompliance & Grant ReportingOversee and adhere to data reporting requirements (i.e. formatting, dependances, etc.) for CPS, ISBE, grant funders, the Intrinsic Schools Board, and other stakeholders in the school community and network and meet deadlines as needed throughout the yearServe as the primary point of contact for data compliance between Chicago Public Schools (CPS) and Illinois State Board of Education (ISBE); attend webinars and meetings as requiredEngage relevant team members on grant reporting with clarity on what is required and whenCreate project plans, where relevant, for data processes that account for on-time kickoff, delivery, as well as accurate reportingClearly communicating process timelines and expectations to key partnersManage data collections submitted by internal and external partners to ensure the accuracy of dataSubmit and validate all metrics on each campus’s annual Illinois Report Card during the Educator Preview Process (before public release).Identify and resolve CPS and/or ISBE compliance errors, such as missing data (i.e. grade, homeless, English learner, etc.) or address corrections in PowerSchool (Intrinsic’s Student Information System)Validate and import data within all relevant data platforms; perform manual edits when necessarySupport both campuses with new student enrollment and monthly attendance auditsTeam SupportBuild relationships and collaborate with team members across various departmentsIncrease data and platform capacity among team members as relevantCreate and/or maintain internal documentation of current processes and proceduresCommit to growing your own data skills and acumenWork with Front Office teams to maintain data consistency between school and district/state data platformsProvide support to tech & data team where needed*_Who You Are_*You believe we must challenge the traditional notions of school to ensure all students receive the education they deserve and need to be successful in college and beyond. You are excited about creating something new and you want to roll up your sleeves and engage in the messiness that comes with the unknown. You’re optimistic, a problem-solver, and enjoy finding flexible, effective solutions where there’s not always a “right” answer. You’ve had opportunities to hone your leadership chops, and know how to influence and guide senior colleagues to provide input, identify priorities and make decisions. You’re comfortable using data to test hypotheses and evaluate efficacy of different ideas. You’re passionate about user-centered design, can learn from failing fast, and believe in rapid iteration. You’re open to feedback, eager to grow, and bring your best to everything you do you like being part of a team.*Ideal Candidate Qualifications*Energy for creating innovative, breakthrough new school models that generate unprecedented results for studentsStrong commitment to advancing equity and justice in education and beyondExcellent oral and written communication skillsStrong analytical skills and keen attention to detailExcellent customer service skill set and ability to adapt to the needs of the organizationAbility to work well both independently and as part of a teamAbility to build strong relationships across the organizationContinued focus on one’s own professional learning as well as capacity building of others within the organizationWilling to provide feedback to stakeholders as necessary and share knowledge with the broader education community*Education and Experience Requirements*Bachelor's degreeStrong organizational and problem solving skills and proven record of successManaging multiple tasks and prioritizing according to organizational needsManaging complex projects across multiple departmentsSupporting and managing multiple key partners toward the completion of a projectDelivering high-quality work against deadlinesWillingness to use a project management tools and ticketing systems to ensure high quality such as ZenDeskMinimum of 3 years of work experience in a fast-paced data-rich environment, experience must include writing code with data analytic tools (dbt, Google Looker Studio, Microsoft BI, Tableau) preferredProficiency in Relational Databases (Google BigQuery preferred)Understanding of PowerSchool, CPS and/or ISBE Student Information Systems preferredExperience in the field of education preferred*Equal Opportunity Employer*Intrinsic Schools is an Equal Opportunity Employer. job_description:
We are looking for a Marketing and Sales Engineer that will be responsible for maintaining and segmenting Summit Interconnect’s customer database, acting as the resident expert for our marketing automation tool (Hubspot), and helping company leaders access and utilize data for insightful decision making.

As a strategic member of the Marketing team, you'll act as the primary administrator of our HubSpot software and ensure the integrity of the CRM database. You will leverage content and industry best practices to drive customer loyalty, capture new contacts, qualify leads, and enhance the overall customer experience. You will track trends across all contacts and build reports that provide data-based analytics to support team and organization-wide needs.

Additionally, you will work closely with company leaders to capture critical data, analyze information, and provide insights that will help drive company direction.

Success in this role will depend on effective collaboration with team members across the entire organization and on the ability to balance multiple priorities.

Responsibilities

Marketing Automation

Optimize existing marketing automation and lead nurturing processes.
Coordinate and move leads through the buyer’s journey, turning leads into customers and customers into advocates.
Build targeted email marketing lists, set up, and execute email campaigns using industry best practices and automation..
Monitor campaigns closely and provide recommendations for improvements using analytics.
Assist in building and distributing customer-facing surveys.
Create and maintain workflows, manage forms, and create landing pages.
Understand and assist with back-end integrations with other systems.
Support additional marketing initiatives as needed, including webinars, intranet site, and event lead management.

CRM Management

Maximize the efficiency of the CRM data and software to improve customer care.
Manage segmentation of contact lists and maintain database integrity.
Oversee lead segmentation, list management, and data enhancement.
Support Business Development and Sales team members' in the use of HubSpot by providing training and documentation.
Act as the liaison between employees and the CRM software.

Metric and Analysis

Responsible for monitoring campaign metrics, developing Marketing metrics to compared against industry benchmarks, and recommending improvements on various campaigns.
Provide state-of-the-art analytics to support all Marketing acquisition and retention programs.
Create and maintain dashboards summarizing marketing and sales activities, effectiveness, and business impact.
Build and share critical reports and metrics with departments across the organization
Collect data on customer actions, identify useful trends, and share insights with other members of the organization.

Qualifications

3 to 5 years of experience in marketing
Proven experience with marketing automation tools (HubSpot or equivalent)
Knowledge of email marketing and contact segmentation methodologies
Exceptional analytical skills
Experience using SQL queries to create reports
Proficiency with Excel and/or Google Sheets, Tableau or similar reporting software
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work effectively in groups and collaborate across departments

Summit Interconnect is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

job_description:
Title: Senior Healthcare Data Analyst
Company: TPC
Reports to: VP, Analytics & Technology
Location: Plano, TX
FLSA Status: Exempt
Updated: September 2022

Company Overview:
TPC is a small company with a big impact, and we are passionate about supporting our Member hospitals in their mission to serve the patients in their communities.

Our Members
Our partnership of 10 community-based, independent health systems recognizes the strength of their numbers and the benefit of collaboration. The Members work through TPC to achieve more together than they could on their own in the areas of sourcing, revenue cycle and performance improvement. As a result, Members have captured more than $400 million in collective savings since 2010.

Our Team
TPC believes in the power of team – not only within our staff, but also with our Members! We serve as an extension of our Member hospitals to reduce costs, drive quality, and increase revenues within their organizations.

We are looking for a highly qualified team member with the right skill set who embodies our cover values.
Accountability: We are accountable for ourselves, our decision, and our work.
Integrity: We show respect and act with integrity.
Excellence: We are passionate about our success.

To learn more about TPC, visit us at TPC1.com. Stronger Together. Superior Results.

Job Purpose:
The Senior Healthcare Data Analyst is responsible for generating and presenting meaningful data trends and insights based on multiple complex datasets and comparative data tools. This position serves as an expert in producing and interpreting standardized healthcare metrics and using that data as a basis for decision-making and driving organizational change.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Optimize reporting and visualization of provider data to convey trends and performance metrics including clinical outcomes, patient experience, labor and staffing cost/utilization, supply and pharmacy costs/utilization and other key performance indicators. Implement and adhere to quality assurance processes to ensure data integrity of reporting.
Identify insights from the comparative analytics tools by drilling into the datasets and working closely with subject matter experts to identify and test hypotheses regarding correlations and causation of data trends and variation of outcomes to comparative data.
Develop and maintain a standardized, consistent methodology for clinical metrics (e.g., quality, labor/staffing, utilization, etc.) and work to advance this common methodology across the TPC Membership.
Work collaboratively with TPC and TPC Members to support usage, interpretation, and predictions of comparative analytics from third parties (Press Ganey, NRC Health, Qualtrics, Premier, Vizient, CMS, Leapfrog and others).
Assist in maintaining data integrity by identifying, triaging and resolving discrepancies and/or omissions in data. Work with TPC Members and third-party suppliers to troubleshoot and resolve challenges.
Support TPC's business functions by providing insights from the comparative analytics tools, as needed, to drive decision-making and prioritization of TPC activities.
Remain current with healthcare metric definitions including key third party metrics (e.g., Vizient, Premier, CMS P4P, Leapfrog, CAHPS, etc.). Attend virtual and onsite training, as needed.
Apply general knowledge of provider operations to guide in the production of meaningful reporting. Conduct basic research, as needed, to ensure reporting is meaningful to the end users (e.g., use of internet information, leveraging available subject matter expertise, etc.).

Minimum Knowledge, Competencies & Qualifications:
Requires Bachelor's Degree, preferably in information technology/sciences, data science, quantitative methods, or similar OR an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities can be acquired.
Minimum of 5 years of using comparative data to draw meaningful and valid insights.
Working knowledge of healthcare provider metrics (e.g., CAHPS, Pay for Performance) or a willingness and aptitude to learn them.
Experience with translating and communicating insights to key stakeholders including visualization.
Proficient in the use of technology to support work activities, e.g., expertise in database extraction, data quality analysis and proven ability to develop charts and graphs to summarize information for reporting purposes, etc.
Strong proficiency in business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) as well as Microsoft Excel.
Proficient in writing complex and optimized queries for analysis (e.g., SQL).
Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Knowledge, Competencies & Qualifications:
Master’s degree in business or data related field.
Three years or more working directly with clinicians to identify data trends and insights.

Travel: Minimum

job_description:
The Gándara Center provides residential, mental health, substance abuse, and preventive services for children, adults, and families across the Pioneer Valley and eastern parts of Massachusetts. Founded in the Hispanic community, we value cultural diversity and strive to provide culturally competent, innovative services to a diverse community. The Mission of the Gándara Center is to promote the well-being of Hispanics, African-Americans, and other culturally diverse populations, through innovative, culturally competent behavioral health, prevention, and educational services.

Reporting to the Chief Information Officer, the Data and Report Analyst works closely with our PQI Team, and Senior staff. Doing so you’ll have an opportunity to use your data analytic skills to provide a detailed understanding of how our business works. In this role, you will focus on integration and reporting. You will work closely with the various Gándara business units to coordinate and maintain the ETL layer between our current systems. Your success will lie in your ability to create compelling dashboards and reports to assist the business in understanding and solving complex problems. In addition, your technical aptitude and ability to create solid reporting and data transformation processes will directly lead to satisfied users and your success.

Responsibilities include:
Maintain, trouble shoot and enhance ETL processes between systems
Create and edit stored procedures, views, functions, and queries on SQL Server to pull required data for reporting purposes using SQL Server Management Studio
Utilize API’s and ODBC connections to gain access to data between disburse systems
Assist in development of data warehouse & data marts
Produce key performance indicator reports for management review
Responsible for designing, building and running regular and ad hoc reports

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or technical training in database design
Proficiency in SQL and SQL query performance tuning, with a working knowledge of SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)
Possess comprehensive knowledge of healthcare-related operations, procedures/functions, and the relationships between them to drive Quality Outcomes Measures and Outcomes
Cognos Reports/Dashboards and SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) is a PLUS
Working knowledge of Data Dashboards a Plus
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) experience a Plus
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Experience in healthcare and business processes preferred
Optional: Experience with Microsoft Power BI systems or Tableau
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
This is an In House Position located in Springfield, MA.

LEADERSHIP, TEAM MANAGEMENT, AND INTERPERSONAL SKILLS

Sensitivity to, and respect for, the diverse world views and different communication styles of individuals of diverse ethnic, linguistic and/or cultures which nurture and shape an organization that celebrates and promotes diversity in its workforce;

Highly effective and well-honed verbal and written communication and presentation skills in English; interpersonal skills necessary to persuade and guide both peers and other Agency staff regarding operational matters. Must have exemplary customer service, compassion, and care in the execution of all duties and interactions.

job_description:
Business Analyst
Remote

ABOUT THE COMPANY: American Expediting is the nation's premier custom transport provider. Our people are smart, creative problem-solvers dedicated to crafting custom transport, logistics, warehousing, and distribution solutions for some of the world's most dynamic brands. Our reputation for excellence is hard-earned, with 99.3% on-time delivery performance for mission-critical, time-critical shipments. And our focus on continuous innovation means we're always ready to meet the ever-evolving needs of our customers.

POSITION SUMMARY: The Business Analyst’s role is to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of stakeholders, be they customers or end users. This includes interviewing stakeholders and gathering and compiling user requirements to understand the technology solutions they need. The Business Analyst will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help the business make good technology decisions. The Business Analyst will also be proactive about working with the Emerging Technology Analyst to look for new technologies to optimize business processes. The Business Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring IT’s understanding of business requirements.

RESPONSIBILTIES:
Strategy & Planning
Collaborate with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision.
Clearly identify project stakeholders and establish user classes, as well as their characteristics.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Identify and establish scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics.
Work with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
Acquisition & Deployment
Assist in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts.
Participate in the QA of purchased solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized.
Participate in the selection of any requirements documentation software solutions that the organization may opt to use.
Operational Management
Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
Develop and utilize standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications.
Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team.
Where applicable, develop prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on user requirements.
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develop and conduct peer reviews of business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options and communicate these back to the business stakeholders.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements – verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
College diploma or university degree in the field of business administration, computer science, finance, or information systems
Three to five years’ related work experience
Occasional evening and weekend work to meet deadlines

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:
Demonstrated knowledge of the organization’s core business process and operations
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development
Experience overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software and hardware solutions, systems, or products
Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language
Exceptional analytical and statistical skills with the ability to apply them to systems issues and products as required
Clear understanding of product management and market placement
Demonstrated project management skills and project management software skills, including planning, organizing, and managing resources
Understanding of application development and software development life cycle concepts
Working knowledge of network and PC operating systems, including Microsoft Windows
Working knowledge of current network hardware, protocols, and standards
Excellent understanding of the organization’s goals and objectives

job_description:
Job description

Meriplex is a managed cybersecurity, IT, and SD-WAN solutions provider that enables transformation by combining secure, innovative technology with advanced expertise. Innovation is our hallmark, and it begins with staff development. Join Meriplex where you will have the opportunity to develop your skills while working alongside a team of enthusiastic industry and technology experts.

Meriplex is looking to add a BI analyst to team!

Responsibilities:
Gather and document business project requirements and process flows.
Analyze business requirements to identify gaps in understanding or missing information
Translate business requirements into functional specifications

job_description:
Scenthound is the first membership-based franchise providing affordable and accessible wellness-focused dog care. Dogs need consistent care to keep all their parts healthy, from their Skin and Coat to their Ears, Nails, and Teeth (S.C.E.N.T.). At Scenthound we’re committed to providing every dog with the care necessary to help maintain their health and keep them clean and happy.

Founded in 2015 and Franchising since 2019, our revolutionary concept, technology-driven strategy, and proven model are fueling rapid nationwide growth. With 40 locations through the end of 2022 and on pace for 100 stores by the end of 2023, Scenthound is establishing itself as the preeminent solution for routine and preventive dog care.

JOB SUMMARY

Reporting to the Chief Technology Officer, the Reporting & Data Specialist is responsible for building and maintaining Scenthound’s corporate, as well as franchisee, facing dashboards and reports. The Scenthound team requires high-quality data, reports, and business intelligence to facilitate successful operations.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Utilize relational databases, data warehouses, and other information resources to provide information and knowledge to key stakeholders
Track, process, and deliver requests for reports and queries in a timely manner
Clearly define outcomes through collaboration with requestors and key business stakeholders. Ensure that all parties agree with the business needs, information requirements, and key data elements that will be utilized.
Create reports and dashboards in Zoho Analytics, with data sourced from Snowflake data warehouse
Query and view design in Snowflake and Zoho Analytics using SQL
Design, build, test and distribute customized and ad hoc reports in alignment with authorized data definitions
Maintain reports in response to individual and business unit requests
Monitor daily automated tasks to ensure proper functioning
Use relevant tools to develop the right solution to meet customer data needs

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE

BA/BS degree; or equivalent related work experience
4+ years of demonstrated experience with relational databases, queries, and data transformations
Experience with ELT tools, including Stitch and Skyvia
In-depth experience understanding of underlying data, data structures and general knowledge of business uses for data
Advanced SQL experience
Passion for and experience in designing data visualizations that communicate information though simplicity

SKILLS & ABILITIES

Strong data modeling skills
Critical thinking, problem solving skills
Ability to define data relationships and author Entity Relationship Diagrams (ERDs)
Ability to work independently and exercise sound decision-making skills
Ability to meet deadlines through effective time management and a results-oriented mindset
Ability to translate user requirements into functional & design specifications
Vision for data relationships and resilient data structures
Commitment to accuracy, testing, and quality

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

Competitive salary commensurate with experience
Health Insurance (Dental, Vision and Medical)
401(k)
Paid time off
Energetic, fun, loving work environment
Unlimited growth potential with an expanding business
Working at a company that is making the difference in the lives of dogs and dog parents!

LOCATION & TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS

Onsite if local to Jupiter, Florida (Scenthound HQ) or Remote
30% Travel

job_description: Morcon Tissue is a family-owned and operated business located in Eagle Bridge, New York. We are looking to add an experienced Sales Operations Analyst to our team. We are looking for someone with excellent communication skills to work with our VP of Sales, marketing team and sales team to promote the best customer service we can. The ideal candidate will possess strong problem solving, organizational, data analysis, critical thinking and communication skills. The ability to multitask and work in a fast paced environment, thinking on your feet and problem solving, interactive with your team and customers, and a strong attention to detail are required. This position is not remote. The Need for a More Data-Driven ApproachThe sales operations analyst role is becoming increasingly data-driven, as businesses are looking for ways to improve their sales processes. This means that the sales operations analysts will need to be able to use data to make decisions and understand what is working and what is not.The sales operations analysts will need to be able to gather and analyze data quickly and effectively. They will also need to be able to communicate the findings of their analysis to other members of the team.More Collaboration Between Sales and MarketingAs marketing and sales become more integrated, the need for a sales operations analyst becomes more apparent.Sales operations analysts are responsible for ensuring that the sales and marketing teams are working together efficiently. This includes tasks such as coordinating campaigns, managing leads, and tracking sales data. By understanding how these two departments work together, sales operations analysts can help to ensure that the company’s resources are being used effectively.A Greater Focus on Customer ExperienceCustomer experience has become an increasingly important focus for businesses in recent years. This is because customers now have more options than ever before, which means that they are more likely to go elsewhere if they are not satisfied with the service they receive.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Data analysis:  Data analysis is the ability to interpret large amounts of information and draw conclusions from it. Sales operations analysts use data analysis to determine how to improve sales and marketing strategies. They analyze data to find trends and patterns, which helps them identify areas of improvement.Communication: Communication is the act of conveying information to others. Sales operations analysts often communicate with other members of a sales team, so excellent communication skills are essential. They also communicate with clients and customers, so they need to be able to explain complex ideas in a way that’s easy to understand.Problem-solving:  Problem-solving skills allow you to identify and address issues that may arise during the sales process. As an sales operations analyst, you may be responsible for ensuring that sales goals are met and that the sales team is aware of any issues that may affect their ability to meet those goals.Critical thinking:  Critical thinking is the ability to analyze a situation and make a decision based on the information you have. Sales operations analysts use critical thinking skills to make recommendations for improving sales processes. They may also use critical thinking to identify areas of improvement for sales processes and make suggestions for how to change them.Organization:  Organization is another skill that can be helpful for sales operations analysts. This is because they often have many tasks to complete in a day and keeping track of all of their responsibilities can help them to be more productive.PRIMARY JOB DUTIES: · Collect and distribute sales reports on a weekly and monthly basis· Develop methods and strategies for assessing large amounts of data using database management, Sage ERP, power queries, etc· Develop, analyze and provide recommendations on VOID reports and sales trend data by Parent, Bill to, Ship to· Manage and update sales budgets and forecasts· Manage and update Customer and Item Profitability Database weekly· Manage and distribute weekly reports such as GAP To Budget, GAP to Open Orders· Use sales prediction software to determine future trends· Manage and track sales Incentive programs· Manage S&OP (Sales and Operations Planning) forecasting and analytics. Work with Material Management and Planning to optimize working capital through improved forecast accuracy· Manage, Implement and Integrate a CRM with Customer Service, Sales, IT, Finance to provide actionable knowledge management (Customer ordering patterns, success of marketing campaigns, promotions, spiffs, etc)· Manage and Report out on Sales Pipeline Key Metrics:o Closure Rateso Total Pipeline $ and Caseso Timing for Closureo Stagnant Accountso Ensure accounts with >75% probability of success to win get transitioned to S&OP forecast· Manage, track and analyze all customer promotion activities working closely with sales, marketing and customer service· Develop pricing strategies to grow share of higher profitability Items· Conduct business case analysis (ROI) on large bid volumes and / or dispenser lease agreements· Conduct analysis on Annual Customer Rebate Programs (SVI, Quarterly, TVI, etc)· Manage all customer rebate templates and send out to the sales team monthlyMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Finance, Marketing and / or EconomicsMinimum of 3-5 years of experience as a analysis orExcellent verbal and written communication skillsStrong computer skillsStrong problem-solving skillsStrong analytical skillsHighly developed attention to detailAbility to work in a team environmentAbility to work in a fast-paced environmentAnalytical problem-solving skillsProficiency with CRM, ERP, and database softwareProficiency with Microsoft Excel, Power Queries and Database ManagementWORKING CONDITIONS: Sales operations analysts work in a fast-paced environment where they are constantly interacting with people, whether it is on the phone, via email, or in person. They need to be able to think on their feet and be quick thinkers in order to solve problems that arise. They also need to be able to work well under pressure and meet deadlines. Sales operations analysts typically work a regular 40-hour workweek, but they may have to work overtime during busy periods.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offReferral programTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:Eagle Bridge, NY 12057: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Work Location: One locationJob Type: Full-timePay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Eagle Bridge, NY 12057: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Experience:Microsoft Powerpoint: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location: One location

job_description:
Position Summary
The Data Analyst position is responsible for supporting the client’s business unit by conducting ad-hoc data queries, building dashboards and analyzing data from various sources to yield end user insights. If you enjoy generating valuable and actionable business information from data analytics, this position is for you!

Duties and Responsibilities:
Design and monitor KPIs to identify developing trends across the product line with the goal to drive business decisions (extract, cleanse and model)
Query and transform data from large datasets to produce insights, generate reports and inform decisions
Build Power BI dashboards to enable a self-service environment
Develop and write in-depth product analysis reports on end user behavior and other valuable market metrics
Perform quality assurance on reports to ensure accuracy and consistency
Help identify opportunities for process improvements across cross functional teams such as marketing
Perform other duties as needed

Job Requirements
Education and Experience: The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent; Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Business Analytics, Data Science or related field preferred
3-5 years of experience in an analytical role; experience with consumer products is preferred
3-5 years of experience in extracting, transforming, and analyzing large data sets using DAX and SQL
3-5 years of experience in designing and developing visualization solutions using Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent enterprise data visualization software
Experience using M365 applications to draft executive level presentations
Experience using Azure Synapse is preferred

Qualifications:
Strong verbal and written communication skills; excellent email, telephone and virtual meeting etiquette
Customer service orientated, ensuring needs are met in a timely fashion
Ability to talk through a data problem and come up with a way to resolve challenges
Ability to quickly analyze large data sets and draw inferences
Ability to take opportunities for continuous improvement and implement documented process improvements
Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently; demonstrated organization, problem-solving, project management, and time management skills
Demonstrated strong ability to remotely work well within a team environment, or independently; strong interpersonal and teamwork skills; ability to work and interact effectively with team members from other disciplines, cultures, and organizations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to effectively inform and present ideas confidently and persuasively to peers and managers
Ability to take initiative to ask questions, ask for help, or provide updates, without reluctance
Ability to meet the eligibility requirements for working in the US without RLA sponsorship for employment visa status
Strong computer skills that include proficiency with MS Office (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio), Teams and SharePoint

Language Skills
Ability to read, write, and speak English proficiently

Physical Demands:
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear.
Frequently required to stand, walk, sit, use hands to feel; reach with hand and arms, and stoop, kneel, or crouch.
The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.
Specific vision requirements include the ability to see at close range, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
At times, may require more than 40 hours per week to perform the duties of the position.

Work Environment:
The position typically operates in a standard office environment.
This role may use standard office equipment such as computer, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines.

job_title: Healthcare Data Analyst - On-Site in AZ
job_benefits: Dental insurance, Health insurance, 401(k), Disability insurance, 401(k) matching
qualifications: SQL, Microsoft Excel, HEDIS, R, Python, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
job_description:
Our Organization:
Come join a company that provides a superb opportunity to learn and advance within healthcare’s most fascinating area of growth! At US Health Systems, an Arkos Health Company, our team delivers advanced, community-based health services to provide quality, patient-focused healthcare. Paired with an integrated system of care comprised of clinical and social services backed by a robust technology platform, our team strives to deliver on our mission to provide advanced, more accessible community-based health services that allow our clients to live healthier, more independent lives.

How you'll make a difference:
The primary responsibility of a Data Analyst is to perform complex analysis in an evolving data environment. The ability to extract and analyze data, clean, and combine disparate data sets, and identify patterns and trends as needed, with the subsequent ability to query and synthesize the data into information consumable by client stakeholders and senior business decision makers.

In this role, the Data Analyst will work collaboratively with all Population Health departments including Clinical Services, Quality/STARs, Provider Education, and Provider Relations to analyze and visualize data to enhance products and reporting tools, and to provide insights on operational efficiency. This role will also work closely with the Product and Tech teams to ensure population health needs are met and communicate clearly with all parties. Responsible for the full lifecycle of analytic activities to include requirements gathering and data designs, development of analytic tools and reporting capabilities, meaningful contributions to data product development and continuous monitoring of performance and quality control plans to identify improvements. The analysis, reporting initiatives, and recommendations will support operational efficiency, product development, and strategic decision making.

Location:
This is a 100% on-site role. The individual must have reliable transportation to our office in Gilbert, Arizona.

**Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.**

All Employee MUST be fully COVID-19 Vaccinated.

Essential Functions

Develop data extracts and reports by interpreting requirements gathered from stakeholders, design the appropriate reports, and identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Collaborate with department heads to analyze effectiveness of the various population health programs
Identify improvements of algorithms for member identification of care needs and risk stratification
Collaborate with the data/product and tech teams to create internal reporting and dashboards related to population health metrics

Communicate clearly with internal departments of mixed technical and clinical backgrounds
Select and use appropriate tools to perform data extraction, modeling, transformation, cleansing, loading, and interpretation
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and design systems, processes, and templates for capturing data then gather and analyze the results
Streamline data collection methods and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
Provide consultation, make recommendations, and assist Arkos stakeholders in implementing data extraction routines
Review reports and performance indicators to locate and correct data issues or gaps

May develop software utilizing various software

Required Skills:
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in healthcare or managed care setting
Bachelor's degree in Business, Health Care Administration, or financial studies, or related field, Master’s degree (preferred)
Experience in quantitative prediction algorithms
Proficiency in SQL, R, Python, Microsoft Office (Excel Master)
Healthcare experience and working knowledge of STARs, HEDIS, RAF, Utilization metrics, MLR/HBR, etc.

Extensive multi-level problem-solving experience

Ability to multi-task, shifting back and forth effectively between two or more activities or sources of information

Benefits:
Employer-paid Medical Insurance
Employer Paid Dental Insurance
Employer-paid vision
Employer-paid Short-term disability
Employer-paid life insurance

Employer matching 401(k)
15 Annual sick/PTO with 8 paid holidays
Paid time off on or around your birthday!

Must complete our Culture Index Survey. Take the assessment at https://portal.cultureindex.com/public/survey/general/bg3VS0H2kF. This is not a pass/fail test and does not measure intelligence.

Arkos Health EEO Statement

All Arkos Health divisions are Equal Opportunity Employers. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other status protected under federal, state or local laws.

Arkos Health is a drug free workplace. All job applicants selected for employment are required to submit to a pre-employment drug test and background check.

job_description:
Location: Savannah, Georgia.

Unis Fulfillment LLC is looking for an IT Business Analyst *for our transportation, warehouse, and logistics teams in Savannah, Georgia. Preferably a candidate who can interface between business, vendor, and technical teams.

We're seeking a passionate and platform-oriented Business Analyst to work with cross-functional teams of engineers and warehouse, transportation, and operational professionals in producing our supply chain systems. You’ll be a part of building and evolving the supply chain platform through requirement collection, process design, business modeling, development, and product launch. You will be among the team to lead the supply chain systems to become an industry-leading platform that can easily launch in any warehouse and support any customers.

Responsibilities

Gather, update, and document user and business requirements from operation teams and clients
Study and identify business issues to optimize process flow and improve efficiency
Review business requirements with the product managers’ development team to ensure the development meets the business needs and the company’s objective
Conduct data analytics, usability studies, and market research/analysis to be utilized in product requirement evaluation and as part of the development process
Use clear requirement writings, process flow charts, and other tools to design solutions and communicate with development teams and users
Perform prototype testing to ensure all requirements have been met
Create manuals and instructions for projects and functions, and provide training sessions for users
Ensure consistency in the business requirement development across the multi-systems within the company from the platform perspective
Evangelize the company mission of using technology to build stronger, safer neighborhoods and effectively release world-class products that grow and improve the platform

Qualifications

3+ years in the Warehouse, Transportation, and logistics industry
Candidate must have a strong IT background
Bachelor’s degree in Business or related field required.
3+ years of business analysis experience
Data analysis skills: 3+ years (Required
Exceptional communication and presentation skills.
Exceptional organizational, analytical, and process improvement skills
Application User Interface Design experience and skill preferred
Thorough understanding of the technical architecture of complex and highly scalable web and mobile applications
Knack for creating simple and delightful user interfaces, with the ability to generate examples through mock-ups and wireframes
Comfort working across the product development spectrum: ideation, strategy, concept work to pixel-level details and implementation
Previous experience in the social networking space is a plus
SQL, Visio, Jira, Axure, or similar tools required.

Meraki: Put your heart and soul into what you do, leaving a piece of yourself in your work.

As a nationally recognized, culture-first company, Meraki prides itself on creating life-altering opportunities for our Sales Reps, providing an environment for our employees to be empowered to embrace their own voice and ideas, and driving our clients towards environmental independence with our quality services.

Meraki curates a distinct working environment that enhances the client experience from the sale, to the installation, and the follow-up once services have been completed.

We are looking for a Remote Salesforce Data Analyst to join our team!

As Meraki Solar grows, we have an ever-increasing need to focus on our data and consume it intelligently. The ideal candidate for this position will be focused on building that initiative. This role will be the first member of the data analysis team, reporting directly to the CIO, and working across the organization to consolidate, organize, and structure Meraki’s approach to reporting.

development, and change management activities

our data

development requirements

manage laterally or upwards

decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a

downstream applications, systems, and processes

fields, workflows, custom views, and other content of intermediate complexity

Wilson Elser is currently seeking a Business Analyst. This role has the flexibility to be fully remote or in person in any office location within EST time zones.

This hands-on Business Analyst position will reside within the Firm’s Business Solutions department, providing major technology platform transformation and change management, where 20+ years of legacy technology and business process is undergoing a complex and strategic overhaul, focused on efficiency, sustainability and providing a competitive industry advantage.

The Firm
Wilson Elser is a full-service and leading defense litigation law firm who faithfully serves our clients with more than 900 attorneys, across 42 offices in the United States and one in London. Founded in 1978, we rank among the top 200 law firms identified by The American Lawyer and 53rd in The National Law Journal's survey of the nation's largest law firms.

The Position

4+ years’ experience in business analysis

Excellent documentation skills.

job_benefits: Dental insurance, Health insurance, Paid time off, 401(k), Vision insurance
qualifications: Power BI, Microsoft Excel, Communication skills, Microsoft Office, Bachelor's degree
job_description:
Matrix Providers - Caring for America's military family.

Serving America's military family by aligning exceptional healthcare workers with rewarding career opportunities.

As a Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Analyst, The financial analyst position is imperative and responsible for analyzing financial statements and predicting the company's future performance. This may include forecasting future revenues and expenditures, modeling capital structure, and budgeting. Analyzing the company's performance alongside changes and market trends. Report to management and stakeholders regarding their findings and may contribute to shaping the company's strategic planning.

Status: Full-time
Compensation: This is a salaried position compensated at $75k to $85k annual
Schedule: Flexible days/hours, weekends
Benefits: Competitive financial package with a comprehensive insurance package including health, dental, vision, and life coverage. Click here to learn about our benefits packages.
Accrued Paid Time Off (PTO) & Paid Holidays
401(k) Plan

The Financial Planning and Analysis Analyst must have the following qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Computer Science, Finance, or Business
4-6 years of relevant work experience in FP&A
Experience Implementing software systems
Two years of advanced experience in Cost Point preferred
Advanced Proficiency in MS Excel required, general proficiency in other MS Office products
Ability to plan, execute and deliver on projects promptly, plus the ability to multi-task on varying projects and initiatives
Very great attention to detail; organized and thorough with a desire for continuous improvement
Demonstrated ability to work as part of a collaborative team with a focus on high professional standards, strong follow-up, and successful project execution
The position requires excellent analytical and critical-thinking skills
Outstanding communication skills (written and oral); ability to communicate in a diplomatic, friendly, yet effective manner internally and externally
Demonstrated experience supporting multiple projects concurrently under deadline pressure and changing priorities
Be comfortable with some degree of ambiguity and be able to define/create tools and processes when needed
Experience working with a diverse team, including across time zones, cultures, and backgrounds

Duties include, but are not limited to:
Project manager for new system implementation from JAMIS to Cost Point
Create, implement, and maintain organizational dashboards, Power BI, SSBI, and Budgeting in ERP System (Cost Point)
Sort/mine large sets of data from multiple data sources to identify trends/variances and to structure sophisticated reports and financial models for decision support
Retrieve, consolidate, and analyze data from ERP System (Cost Point)
Prepare and review the organizational annual forecast/budgeting process in coordination with Controller and CFO
Build and maintain budget and forecast templates for use by other staff
Hold monthly budget meetings with department heads to review budgets vs actuals
Create ad hoc templates, reports, and analyses for use by managers to evaluate their activities/programs, including industry benchmarking
Work with data sets to address complex, non-routine analysis using sound statistical approaches
Increase productivity by improving current methods used in the collection of financial data, coordinating information requirements, and developing automated financial reporting/forecasting tools where needed
Evaluate financial status and risks by analyzing actual results in comparison with budgets and forecasts while working closely with the Finance team to ensure accurate financial reporting and decision support
Make business recommendations based on a presentation of quantitative information
Create, implement, and maintain Matrix's FP&A policies, systems, and processes to ensure understanding and manage potential impacts of changes to and developments for supported systems
Other duties, as assigned

Matrix Providers is an equal-opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. For our EEO Policy Statement, please click here.

Matrix Providers endeavors to make www.matrixproviders.com accessible to all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please get in touch with our Recruiting Hotline Number, 1-877-807-8277, TTY LINE, 385-722-8109. This contact information is for accommodation requests only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

job_description:
Peterson Health is a not-for-profit rural community hospital located in Kerrville, TX. We are among the nation’s Best Places to Work and pride ourselves on our compassionate and team-oriented culture. We offer competitive pay, paid time off, as well as health and retirement benefits to our employees.

Responsible for organizing and managing large and varied data sets and analyzing healthcare data to optimize business operations and quality improvement priorities. The data analyst must be able to research, understand and mimic scoring and financial reimbursement methodologies and use data visualization and detailed reports to communicate findings to Peterson Health leaders. Responsibilities include planning, organizing, coordinating and directing quality teams to support improvements in clinical practice, service quality, and regulatory compliance. The QA is responsible for the day-to-day support of strategic quality and process improvement. The QA directs programs, departments, leaders, and the medical staff by providing leadership and guidance in supporting a quality culture, quality activities, establishing measurements to monitor performance, ensuring high data integrity, role modeling CQI principles, and teaching and training others to promote the principles of performance improvement.

EDUCATION
Required: Formal training or experience in data analysis and continuous quality improvement principles, tools and techniques.
Preferred: Associate or bachelor's degree

TECHNICAL SKILLS
Required: Math and PC-based computer skills including Word and Excel. CQI tools and techniques and the use of best practice concepts and tools. Knowledge of regulatory standards related to the monitoring of health information and performance improvement.
Preferred: Demonstrates ability to effectively train, presents to large and small groups, facilitate teams and act as a consultant to clinical and non-clinical departments/programs. Can identify and analyze group dynamics and recommend interventions in collaboration with peers.

CERTIFICATION
Preferred: Lean Six Sigma Training Certification and/or Certified Professional in Heatlh Care Quality (CPHQ)

EXPERIENCE
Required: Minimum 3 years of applicable healthcare data analysis
Preferred: One year applicable quality improvement experience

job_description: St. Johns County Board of County Commissioners is seeking a Traffic Systems Analyst for our well-established Public Works Department located in beautiful St. Augustine, Florida.St. Johns County residents enjoy a healthy quality of life with many perks including the #1 rated public school system in the State of Florida, miles of beach shoreline, peaceful estuary scenery of the St. Johns River, long established agriculture and equestrian scene, and the nation’s oldest city, historic St. Augustine. job_description:
General Summary:
The Human Resource HR Analyst IV will collect, compile, and analyze HR data, metrics, and statistics, and apply this data to make recommendations related to recruitment, retention, data reporting, and legal compliance. Will assist with Workday data management and processing.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Collects and compiles HR metrics and data from a variety of sources including the human resource information system (HRIS) and payroll outputs, management and employee surveys, exit interviews, employment records, government labor statistics, competitors, practices, Workday, and other sources. Analyzes data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to recruitment, hiring practices, motivation, turnover, and compliance with employment laws and regulations. Data management, personnel actions and compensation related activities in Workday. May conduct or assist with conducting classification audits to ensure that jobs are properly classified as exempt or nonexempt. Ensures compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices. May assist HR leadership with Open Records Request and salary analysis. May guide and/or assist with performance and compensation review and evaluation processes. Performs other duties as assigned.

MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED: Bachelors degree from an accredited college or university in Business Administration, Computer Technology or related field. With Four (4) years progressively responsible experience related areas such as job classification and compensation, recruitment, selection, training, and/or equal opportunity compliance preferred, including one year in a Compensation or HRIS Workday environment. Proficiency with personal computer (PC) and software applications to include Workday, Tableau, Windows, word processing and database. Demonstrated knowledge of Lawson or related software, spreadsheets, and Crystal Reports programs. Demonstrated knowledge of excel formulas to include pivot point, vlookup and other validation formulas. Ability to demonstrate a fiduciary obligation to section, division, department, and DART in handling materials and information of a confidential nature. Ability to be dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers. Acts with customers in mind. Establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect. Ability to pick up on technical things quickly. Can learn new skills and knowledge. Is good at learning new industry, company, product, or technical knowledge. Ability to be able to write clearly and succinctly in a variety of communication settings and styles. Can get messages across that have the desired effect. Ability to quickly find common ground and solve problems for the good of all. Can represent his/her own interests and yet be fair to other groups. Can solve problems with peers with a minimum of noise. Is seen as a team player and is cooperative. Easily gains trust and support of peers. Encourages collaboration. Can be candid with peers. Ability to use rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions.

WORKING CONDITIONS: Works in an environment where there is minimum exposure to dust, noise, or temperature. May be moderately exposed to unpleasant working conditions to include dust, noise, temperature, weather, petroleum products, and chemicals while visiting DART's operating facilities, assuming incumbent is observing all policies and procedures, safety precautions and regulations, and using all protective clothing and devices provided.

DART is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer, supporting diversity in the workplace. M/F/D/V

job_description: Summary Assists Performance Improvement Director in leading ECH efforts to foster high quality and continuously improving services. In support of this task, model a quality improvement ethic, employ specialized knowledge, skills and provision quality improvement infrastructure and activities.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following.· Maintain working knowledge of accreditation (COA), licensure (DSS and DHSS), contractual (multiple local, state and federal arrangements) and regulatory requirements (principally HIPAA, OSHA and related health and safety) for which ECH is accountable.· Interpret external requirements for applied purposes. Articulate ECH’s expression of requirements in ongoing administrative and service delivery operations.· Develop processes that strengthen operations relative to requirements, minimize risk and promote best practices.
