job_description:
Major purpose:
The Distribution Quality & Logistics Analyst is responsible for thermal packaging system quality and distribution protocols to ensure proper medication conditions during transit. Leads and conducts thermal packaging system assessment, qualification, implementation, optimization, and testing. Evaluates thermal packaging options and distribution protocols with consideration to effectiveness, cost, sustainability, geographic temperature profiles, and Ardon’s operations. Implements thermal packaging systems and distribution protocols under clinical and operational oversight.

Mission: To inspire people and improve lives through the delivery of high-quality, compassionate healthcare services.
Every position at Ardon has a direct impact on Ardon’s ability to deliver on its mission. Each team member has the responsibility to support the Company’s quality program activities to ensure quality remains the centerpiece of Ardon’s operations.

Benefits:
Competitive pay
Flexible PTO and paid company holidays
Medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance
401K match

Position specifications:
Education and experience

Required:
One or more years’ experience gathering, analyzing, and interpreting data

Preferred:
Knowledge of thermal packaging systems and distribution logistics
One or more years’ pharmacy or other relevant industry experience
Experience in quality assurance and continuous improvement
Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, life sciences, or equivalent
Physical and mental functions and activities
Must have excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Must be able to complete work by assigned deadlines.
Must have excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
Must be able to express oneself, detect, perceive, observe, and assess information exchanged in a variety of communication methods.
Must be able to demonstrate proficiency with computer applications.
Must be able to work independently as well as part of a team.
Working conditions
Work is performed in an office environment, with extensive keyboard and telephone work in stationary position.
Additional work is performed in a pharmacy environment, with extensive keyboard and computer work. Work also involves moving of packaging, boxes, and items from different areas within the warehouse. Packaging supplies weighing 40 pounds are moved from the freezer to workstations.
Business needs may occasionally require work in excess of 40 hours per week, including work outside of standard work week.

Contact with others:
Internally with Ardon employees across multiple departments.
Externally with vendors

Essential functions and activities:
Leads and conducts thermal packaging system qualification and ongoing testing for quality assurance.
Analyzes data to ensure compliance with medication storage standards throughout the distribution process.
Leads root cause analysis and proposes solutions.
Evaluates thermal packaging options and distribution protocols with consideration to effectiveness, cost, sustainability, geographic temperature profiles, patient satisfaction, and Ardon’s operations.
Implements thermal packaging systems and distribution protocols under clinical and operational oversight.
Explores and evaluates alternate thermal packaging system materials, supply vendors and distribution services.
Presents metrics and analysis periodically and as needed or requested.
Monitors geographic temperature profiles and guides distribution logistics protocols.
Creates, maintains, and owns thermal packaging system and distribution protocols. Follows change control processes.
Explores available technologies and optimizes use to support operational execution of distribution protocols, in collaboration with operational leadership.
Communicates externally with vendors to obtain product and service information.
Adapts to shifting priorities and modifies processes to ensure regulatory requirements, accreditation standards, and policies and procedures continue to be met.
Serves as a subject matter expert (SME) in thermal packaging systems, distribution, and validation. Interprets relevant accreditation standards and participates in accreditation processes.
Creates and coordinates communication and staff education with clinical and leadership oversight.
Conducts periodic quality audits of packages.
Ensures adequate supply of essential thermal packaging materials and proposes timely solutions to address supply chain disruptions.
Optimizes thermal packaging material storage and organization. Explores alternate storage strategies as necessary.
Assists with pharmacy production and warehouse area projects as requested.
Supports quality department projects, initiatives, and audits as requested.
Actively participates and provides support as needed to leadership and quality program staff to ensure activities related to the company’s quality management program and quality improvement activities maintain priority focus and are effectively executed. This may include but is not limited to activities that promote objective and systematic measurement, monitoring, and evaluation of services and defined Quality Improvement Projects (QIPs) that may result from such efforts.
Complies with the company’s Human Resources policies, Employee Handbook, Code of Conduct, and all department policies and procedures, including protecting confidential company, employee, and customer information; attending work punctually and regularly; and adhering to good safety practices in all activities.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Ardon Health seeks to allow equal employment opportunities for all qualified persons without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, sexual identification or orientation, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law. Offers of employment are conditional upon proof of COVID-19 vaccination.

job_description: POSITION: Agile Quality and Process Performance Analyst (AQA)LOCATION: Washington, DCJOB SUMMARYThe AQA will support the government staff in monitoring all aspects of contractor execution, including: performance management, system integration, IV&V, Deliverable Quality Assessment, consulting services, adherence to the government System Development Life Cycle (SDLC), SAFe Agile framework and guidelines, and the specific requirements of the individual task order’s Statement of Work (SOW). The AQA will assess contractor quality and performance through the use project management, software repository and document repository systems.to inspect project deliverables as well as performance status metrics. When needed the AQA will utilize advanced data analytics techniques and tools to provide trend analysis, project performance forecasts and provide reports on overall project status as well as recommendations to the Government on how to address and improve project quality. The AQA will use tabular as well as visual charting static as well as interactive to provide insights to other team members as well as the Government on what the metrics and indicators show about current status and future directions. The AQA needs to be a self starter, able to work independently and or as part of a team to provide the insights required.Team J3 is seeking an Agile Quality and Process Performance Analyst with specialized experience in working in Agile Software Development Environments. The candidate must exhibit initiative and the ability to self-direct tasks with little guidance. The Analyst must be skilled in using the tools used by Agile Development teams and be able to extract relevant data from these systems to provide tactical as well as strategic insights to Project Managers as well as Product/Business Owners and Executives. The Analyst must be skilled in using advanced tools and methods to bring together data from disparate systems, integrate it and use it to assess the overall strategic health of the project as well as the quality of the project’s deliverables. Data Analytics Experience as well as well-developed programming skills and a deep understanding of Agile processes is a must. The ability to take raw data and information and put it into a format that can communicate critical information to consumers at very technical to executive levels is a must. Understanding of a Software Development Management Toolset such as Rational or Jira, Collaboration systems such as SharePoint or CoLab is required although the candidate must be able to adjust to using new technologies if they are adopted by the project team. Candidates must also have highly advanced MS Excel, Microsoft BI, Tableau skills and be able to use the tools as part of their Analysis process. As a member of our team, you will collaborate with Software Developers, DBAs, Systems Administrators, and Users to gain insight on their approach towards completing project deliverables using Agile methodologies.Finally, the candidate must have advanced problem identification, analysis skills and using that develop tactical as well as strategic recommendations to increase the quality and/or performance of the project.ResponsibilitiesQualifications: The most qualified candidates will possess:· 10 years of General IT experience· Applications Development Experience (in Agile development environment preferred)· Advanced Data Analytics Skill and Experience· Project Management Professional (PMP) certification from the Project Management Institute (PMI)· Agile Certified - solid understanding of SAFe Agile Processes· Working knowledge of IV&V processes and best practices.· Solid understanding of systems development life cycle methodologies and application development practices· Working knowledge of and experience with Agile Software Development Processes (Scrum).· Familiar with strategic information planning, business process reengineering and management practices.Education and Experience: · Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Information Systems, Engineering, or similar discipline.Required Skills and Competencies: · Full understanding of Applications Development SDLC Frameworks· Agile Certification at minimum a Certified Scrum Master Certification· Experience in using Software Development Management Toolset such as Rational or Jira· Experience in using collaboration systems such as SharePoint or CoLab· Highly advanced MS Excel, Microsoft BI, Tableau skills and be able to use the tools as part of their Analysis process.· EXCEL Skills a MUST (Senior Level) able to demonstrate writing Macro's and Functions, also able to Create Charts and Pivot Tables· Programming Skill in VBA (MS Excel), Java, Python, C# or other high-level language preferred· Experience in High Level Platform Development Languages such as PEGA or Salesforce.· SQL Query Language skills / experience (MySQL, Oracle, etc.)· Excellent oral and written communication skills· Microsoft PowerPoint Skills.· Strong analytical skills and a methodical approach to problem solving· Function well in a collaborative team environment· Strong ability to document processes and procedures· Successful candidate is subject to a background investigation by the government and must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance.Job Types: Full-time, Temporary, ContractPay: $110,000.00 - job_description:
Company Description

Sia Partners is a next-generation consulting firm dedicated to creating state-of-the-art narratives for transformation and innovation and deploying them at scale. Our goal is to deliver superior value and tangible results to our clients as they navigate the digital revolution and achieve transformations which generate a positive impact. Our global footprint and expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allow us to enhance our clients’ businesses worldwide. We guide their projects and initiatives in strategy, business transformation, IT & digital strategy, and Data Science.

Why Join The Sia Village?

Excellence | Entrepreneurship | Innovation | Teamwork | Care & Support | Employee Wellbeing

These are the six core values that guide all our actions. As an expression of our values, our Sia Village concept describes our commitment to fostering a sense of community within and among our offices. We believe that knowledge sharing is the key, not only to innovation, but to the growth and development of our people.

Your experience at Sia Partners will be enriched by a(n):
Entrepreneurial journey
Career advocacy program that supports achieving professional development goals through guidance, and real-time feedback
Continuous learning & development opportunities
Diversity, equity, and inclusion programs with an ever-growing list of global affinity initiatives
Annual seminar, an in-person value-add experience, that allows you to network with colleagues throughout North America



Drive work within project teams and with a variety of business stakeholders to ensure that all business requirements are understood, documented, and met
Using Business Analyst industry tools & techniques, document information needs and functional requirements
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customer and technology stakeholders
Research, analyze, recommend, and participate in the deployment of solutions
Provide exceptional client delivery, exceed client expectations
Contribute to internal areas such as business development, infrastructure, people development, recruiting, marketing, and more
Engage in activities dedicated to support our culture
Ability to drive data, metrics, and a structured approach to identifying clients’ problems and developing solutions
Ability to solve broad business or technology problems by using principles derived from a deep understanding of disparate and complex data
Experience with Business Requirement Documents (BRD) and translation of BRD to functional specifications and traceability matrices
Experience presenting data-driven analyses based on business benefits to solve highly complex business and technical problems
Ability to break down complex problems into clear and simple terms
Ability to systematically consider the implications of problems and solutions in multiple domains at once, and solve problems across all domains

Qualifications

2+ years of relevant business analysis experience (see details below)
Consulting experience required
Bachelor’s degree required
Preference for technology, healthcare, mobile/telecom, financial services and/or retail organizations experience and desire to work on technology projects
Experience implementing moderately complex initiatives with demonstrated leadership in facilitation, planning, negotiation, and analysis
Proficient with the Microsoft Office Suite
CBAP certification (or similar) a strong plus
SQL, Tableau and/or PowerBI experience highly desirable

Additional Information

Compensation & Benefits

Salary + Annual Discretionary Bonus
Healthcare coverage that includes medical, dental, vision and life insurance policies
Generous time off
Parental leave paid at 100% of base pay for all new parents regardless of gender
Future Moms Program
9 Company Holidays + 1 Floating Holiday
401(k) matching
College save-up plan & college loan repayment plan
Monthly cell phone stipend
Commuter Benefits
Gym Reimbursement through firm medical plan

Compensation Information:
Compensation in Seattle is between $122,000 and $139,000 annually

Our Commitment To Diversity

Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB) are part of Sia Partners’ DNA. Thanks to our expertise in several sectors and our international growth, our teams include a variety of experiences and cultures. We’re confident that promoting DEIB creates an environment in which everyone can reach their full potential.

Our global network, DEIB@Sia Partners, brings together our people worldwide to facilitate local and global progress, focused on the following areas:

Gender equality (global Gender Equality Index score of 91/100 for FY19-20)
LGBTQ+
Race & Ethnicity
Working Parents
Disabilities

Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Covid-19 Update

Please note that, to the extent permitted by state and local law, Sia Partners requires all employees in this position to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. “Fully vaccinated” means that the individual can provide acceptable proof that the individual has received, at least fourteen (14) days prior to the individual’s start date, either both doses of a two-dose COVID-19 vaccine plus all boosters recommended for you, or one dose of a single-dose COVID-19 vaccine plus all boosters recommended for you. Vaccines must be authorized and/or approved by the FDA. The Company will engage in an interactive process to determine if an exemption to this requirement as a reasonable accommodation is appropriate.

Hybrid Workplace Guidelines

Sia Partners maintains its hybrid workplace arrangements and provides a flexible workplace environment that is driven by client and business/market needs. While our firm does support hybrid work, there are times that we may require our consultants to work onsite at one of our Sia offices or a client office full-time. Consultants are expected to have the ability to be flexible with work location depending upon business needs. When in-between client engagements, Consultants typically work onsite at a local Sia office 2+ times per week.

To learn more about our mission, values, and business sectors, please visit our website.

JOB SUMMARY:
The Revenue Cycle Analyst is responsible for centralized reporting within the Revenue Cycle, for preparing and maintaining performance improvement financial reporting and providing various data analysis as requested by Revenue Cycle leadership. The Revenue Cycle Analyst will work with the internal and external stakeholders to incorporate findings, as assigned.

MAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIES / CRITICAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Prepares monthly reports, analysis, and formal presentations for departmental and administration leadership.
Develops and utilizes reports to track financial and operational performance across the entire spectrum of the revenue cycle.
Extracts, collates, and refines data from multiple sources to manipulate into one reporting set using Microsoft Excel, eCW, Tableau and other practice management systems as needed.
Develop new report templates for ad-hoc and or standard monthly reports to assist with monitoring of revenue cycle metrics. Provides a detailed assessment of revenue cycle processes with a focus on process improvement and best practices. Monitor and analyze to compare with industry benchmarks.
Collaborates closely with peers to develop, validate, and maintain meaningful report sets.
Provides on-going detailed assessments of revenue cycle processes with focus on process improvement and best practice.
Identifies revenue cycle problems, research/analyzes data to resolve issues, identifies, and selects alternatives to address outstanding issues, and works with management to implement solutions for improvement.
Monitors ongoing performance of Revenue Cycle results using key performance indicators (KPI). Use data to identify trends and gaps. Uses dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators of revenue cycle workflows and to ensure a holistic view of the revenue cycle.
Performs data analysis, report writing and presentation of findings to management.
Provides analysis to support the development of budgets, financial and operating goals, and establishment of staffing levels.
Maintains appropriate documents, reports, and files comply with all applicable laws and policies.
Conforms to all applicable HIPAA, Billing Compliance, and safety policies and guidelines.

Required Skills

QUALIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business, Finance, Health Administration or equivalent.
2-4 years of relevant experience in healthcare finance/accounting, revenue cycle, financial analysis and/or decision support functions.
Knowledge of Revenue Cycle business processes preferred.
Strong personal computer literacy required including working knowledge of relevant software packages such as Microsoft Office (Excel, Access, Powerpoint, and Word), and familiarity with a practice management and hospital patient accounting system(s) such as Meditech and eCW. Knowledge of SQL, Tableau a plus.
Ability to work with large amounts of data, including checks for integrity, summation, and effective communication (written and verbal) to internal and external constituents.
Organized and effective at dealing with many activities simultaneously; strong planning and organizing skills required.
Self-starter with the ability to work independently at times when necessary.
Demonstrates the highest degree of accuracy and readability for all work and team projects.
Uses, protects, and discloses patients’ protected health information (PHI) only in accordance with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) standards.
Committed to on-going professional development as evidenced by membership and continuing education in HFMA, or other healthcare accounting / finance professional organizations.

We are committed to building an inclusive workplace that values diversity and inclusion and reflects the diversity of the community and patients we serve
Required Experience

Job Summary: The Business Analyst will act as the liaison for Business Units, vendors, and Information Technology and will be responsible for analyzing, improving, or creating workflow efficiencies and to provide project management assistance to help produce positive outcomes.

Analyze, create, improve, and validate existing workflows, processes, or procedures.
Assist and work with Project Manager and provide reports, timelines, or relevant updates to stakeholders and Information Technology.
Collaborate with vendors and Information Technology to provide guidance to the business.
Develop an understanding of the structure, policies, and operations of the organization to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals.
Discover, research, and evaluate new technologies that would benefit various business units.

Minimum of one (1) to three (3) years of related work experience is preferred. Experience in a credit union or banking environment is ideal. Experience with process improvement, business process mapping of current and future states, and business requirements analysis in a credit union or banking environment.

Highly resourceful and know when/how to be assertive to make progress, but able to remain calm, composed, and flexible in challenging circumstances. Excellent analytical skills. Excellent interpersonal & communication skills, both oral and written are essential. Proven ability to exercise independent judgement for decision making and creative problem-solving. Ability to learn complex systems, integrations, processes from a vast selection of systems and platforms. Familiar with banking systems a plus. Proficient in using Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Visio. Knowledge of any Business Intelligence or Data Analytics platforms, SQL Server Reporting or PowerBI would be ideal.

job_description:
Job Summary
The Inventory Analyst, is a qualified individual in charge of managing the inventory of all raw, packaging and finished goods used by the company, within all locations. This role will develop SOPs for the business to reduce inventory loss, control day-to-day inventory operations, and implement inventory control protocols.

Essential Functions
Perform inventory reconciliations and research discrepancies, such as missing or mislabeled items, and work with the business to rectify.
Develop and implement systems for accurately managing inventory.
Develop/create process consistencies between all plants and 3rd parties.
Develop and conduct regular cycle count calendar and processes.
Recommend corrective actions to improve inventory performance and utilization, as well as guaranteeing efficient and robust inventory controls are put in place.
Work with Finance to ensure inventory and related accounts are reported accurately and in a timely manner.
Maintain and improve the company’s inventory situation by analyzing inventory statistics regularly to determine which products are selling and which are not being sold
Analyze data and generate monthly reports to ensure inventory accuracy.
Serve as the subject matter expert for everything inventory control related, SOPs, etc.

Essential Skills and Abilities
Results-oriented, metrics-driven individual with experience in inventory management, spreadsheets, and ERP systems.
Superior analytical skills to be able to develop solutions and processes related to inventory utilization that will drive cost control and efficiencies.
Computer skills. - Microsoft Office, Excel, ERP Software.
Strong time management and organizational skills with the ability to deliver to deadlines with strong follow-up skills, problem resolution, and strategic thinking.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to respond to changing situations despite deadlines and pressure.
Ability to travel 20%.

Education/Certification
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Accounting, Purchasing or Supply Chain

Experience
3+ years of experience in a high volume, high growth, food manufacturing environment
Strong experience with databases and spreadsheets
Strong analytical skills, time management, and problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail and multi-tasking skills

We offer a great opportunity with a comprehensive salary and benefits package including medical, dental, life insurance, short-term disability, 401K with company match, and vacation

Richelieu Foods, Inc. is a leading national private label and contract packing food manufacturer focused on frozen pizza, salad dressing, and BBQ sauce product categories. We have four manufacturing facilities located in OH, IL, IA, and WI. We provide products to many national retailers, wholesalers, distributors, club and mass stores, as well as industrial accounts including other food manufacturers.

job_description:
Company Description

You may know us as FIJI Water, POM Wonderful, Justin Wine, Teleflora and Halos Citrus, but we’re all Wonderful – and we have a great opportunity for a Business Systems Analyst (Supply Chain Planning).

The Business Systems Analyst will plan, implement and support system solutions in demand management, sales & operations planning, supply planning, production scheduling etc. using various Oracle value chain planning products (Oracle Fusion Planning modules, Demantra etc) and other planning products.

Are you willing to relocate to Delano, CA? This position will be based at our Delano, CA office and working a hybrid schedule with 3 days per week in the office.

Visa & relocation assistance provided


Solution Development:
Consult with business unit management to identify business needs, understand current operational procedures and problems in Demand Management, Supply planning, sales & operations planning and other planning areas.
Define solutions in Oracle Fusion SCP, Oracle Demantra/VCP/EBS or other implemented planning products for various business needs, communicate in clear terms to business users the solution options and assist them in decision making.
Create and update solution and process documents.
Create requirements, functional specifications, unit and integrated test scenario documents and other relevant artifacts necessary for implementation of IT solution.

Project and Task Management:
Create and maintain project plans to implement approved IT projects.
Direct partner and internal resources on project tasks.
Monitor project activities per the plan and communicate status to key stakeholders.
Communicate and coordinate development from geographically dispersed teams.

Operational Support:
Identify, evaluate, and resolve day-to-day support issues in area of Oracle fusion SCP, planning applications and Demantra.
Coordinate with offshore resources on successful resolution of support tickets.
Create / update end user training documents and guides.
Provide hands-on training to end users on various aspects of applications.

Qualifications

Minimum of 6-8 years of experience in implementing enterprise applications with at least 4 years in implementing Oracle Value Chain Planning products (ex ASCP); Demantra modules or one of the advanced planning applications.
Should have performed at least 3 full life cycle implementations of planning modules in recent releases.
Strong functional knowledge in core SCP products and integration to Oracle Fusion R13 / EBS R12.
Experience working in a multi divisional environment with one VCP platform and multiple executions systems (Oracle fusion / ERP) is preferred.
Willingness to learn, implement and support new applications and technologies.
Knowledge of OUM (Oracle Unified Methodology) or equivalent.
Knowledge of standard project management and milestone-based task management.
Ability to work in a fast paced, multi-project environment and support multiple internal customers.
Knowledge of industry best practice approaches and standards.
A Bachelor's degree is required.

Functional Skills:
Expert level knowledge in setup and configuration of:
Oracle Advanced Supply Chain Planning (ASCP)
Oracle Fusion Planning Central
Oracle Fusion Demand Management
Demantra PTP (Predictive Trade Planning, and deductions settlement)
Demantra DM
Demantra S&OP

Working Knowledge in the configuration of:
Oracle Account Receivables
Oracle Order Management and Pricing
Oracle Purchasing

Technical Skills:
Advanced working knowledge of SQL.
Working knowledge of PL/SQL.
Working knowledge of tables, views and schema objects of Oracle ERP and Demantra.
Knowledge of Oracle ERP collection / integration to Demantra and ability to troubleshoot data interface issues.
Ability to write simple, custom logic routines within ERP and Demantra.

Pay Range: $118,750 - $125,000, and may include a discretionary bonus. Final compensation will be dependent upon skills & experience.

Additional Information

Wonderful's Dedication to You:
Competitive benefits package including Medical (including 24/7 online access to a physician), Vision, Dental and 401k with match eligibility
Opportunities for development and internal mobility
Manager and leadership training, biweekly L&OD webinars, and eLearning offerings
Companywide problem solving and continuous improvement training
Wonderful Giving (wonderfulgiving.com) - allowing you to donate company money to a cause of your choice
Company focus on wellness and health including virtual yoga and mindful meditation classes

Headquartered in Los Angeles, The Wonderful Company is a privately held $5 billion company dedicated to harvesting health around the world through its iconic consumer brands. The company’s 10,000 employees worldwide are committed to bringing consumers everywhere the freshest, most wholesome pistachios, citrus and pomegranates; bottling the finest water and wines; and creating colorful bouquets that are sure to touch the heart. This commitment is reflected in the company’s market share: Wonderful Pistachios® is America’s No. 1 tree nut and America’s fastest-growing snack; Wonderful® Halos® is the No. 1 mandarin orange in America; POM Wonderful® is the No. 1 100% pomegranate brand in America; FIJI® Water is America’s No. 1 premium imported bottled water brand; JUSTIN® Wine has the No. 1 Cabernet Sauvignon in California; and Teleflora® is the world’s leading floral delivery service.

The Wonderful Company’s connection to consumers has health at its heart and giving back at its core. The company has a long-standing commitment to corporate social responsibility, including more than $1 billion invested in environmental sustainability; $65 million in charitable giving, education initiatives, and innovative health and wellness programs each year; and $143 million toward the construction of two charter school campuses in California’s Central Valley.

To learn more about The Wonderful Company, its products and its core values, visit www.wonderful.com, or follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. To view the current Corporate Social Responsibility report, visit www.wonderful.com/csr.

The Wonderful Company is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Overview:
Axient is seeking an Administrative Business Analyst to support our customer in Huntsville, AL.

Responsibilities:
Perform routine actions such as creating, managing, and maintaining databases, such as SharePoint and shared drive resources, to include but not limited to: tracking status of contract actions/deliveries, suspense dates, training, and reviewing correspondence for correction of deficiencies; meeting organization and preparation, and tracking action items.
Perform administrative support tasks, from receptionist and visitor control tasks to the preparation, coordination, and publication of a wide variety of documents, graphics, presentations, spreadsheets, schedules, and other administrative products.
Operates with broad direction to support administrative functions, with focus on administrative processes, procedures, tools, and protocol to perform a robust range of administrative tasks, such as maintaining executive schedules and communication, overseeing the administrative operations of a large office or organization, and coordinating large events requiring substantial discretion and attention to protocol.
Maintain appointment calendars, VTC and conference room schedules.
Schedule meetings and conferences including those involving staff from outside the immediate office.
Facilitate a wide variety of reports, and other documents, determining and modifying format, content and frequency from information obtained from staff, files and other sources.
Provide administrative support functions for the government office to include synchronizing calendars, reporting project milestones, organizing meetings, calendar invites, answering phone calls, and conducting travel coordination.
May include monitoring of Knowledge Management Support Tools (KMST), for tracking of time and attendance, educational and training requirements for personnel.
Support technical and management personnel; transmitting documents and data files; providing general support for business meetings and other events, and maintain various organizational databases; tracking performance reports, personnel action requests, providing strategic resource management, file management and tracking data call requests.
Prepare and support budget and financial planning and reporting, and program performance, cost, and schedule analysis.
Prepare and review funding documents (DD Form 448 Military Interdepartmental Purchase Request (MIPR), DD Form 448-2 Acceptance of MIPR, Financial Requisition Summaries (FRS), and government Purchase Requisitions (PR), for accuracy in accordance with applicable internal controls, Army regulations, guidelines, and audit procedures.
Familiarization with financial Spend Plans and forecasts by month and by CLIN / ACRN structure (i.e. Labor, Travel, ODC, etc.) to include identifying variances affecting project execution.
Experience identifying amount of funds available for de-obligation and determining re-obligation based on appropriation category (RDT&E / O&M).
Ability to recognize and resolve Unliquidated Obligations (ULO) and Negative Unliquidated Obligations (NULO).
GFEBS experience strongly desired.

job_description:
Our Mission

At Dobbs Defense, we deliver mission-centric IT, Cyber, and data analytics solutions for our government and commercial clients through the convergence of automation, innovation, training, and education. Delivering high-quality IT, cybersecurity, and data analytics solutions through proven and innovative methods is our vision.



Dobbs Defense Solutions is seeking a Mid Business Analyst to support our client. This individual will be responsible for interacting with the application team or across multiple application teams and with clients daily to perform functional & technical requirements analysis, documentation, and validation for new and existing software development. The Analyst will be involved in all aspects of the software development lifecycle as changes and enhancements to the system are implemented, and will create new or update existing user stories, acceptance criteria, wireframes, and other supporting documentation. This individual will also assist in the preparation of weekly status reports and presenting status updates to the team and client. As needed, the analyst will help product owners prioritize development tasks and stories, facilitate scrum ceremonies, remove team impediments, and coordinate with other scrum teams to deliver high quality products.

Duties

Analyzing and documenting system capability, conducting requirements gathering sessions and analyzing data to identify issues or questions
Provide recommendations to product owners/management
Developing requirements documentation such as: User Stories, System Requirements, Use Cases (Gherkin method preferred) and Acceptance Criteria

Qualifications

Required Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field and 6 years of relevant experience
4 years of direct work experience in a business analysis capacity, including all aspects of business process and requirement elicitation, documentation, and testing
2 years of working experience as an Agile Business Analyst
Understanding of Screen and User Interface designs (wireframes), Front End Test Documentation (Sprint Review), User Guides/Online Help documentation, Release Notes, End User Communication, and Training materials
Expertise in JIRA and Confluence, and IBM Rationale Suite - including ClearQuest
Proficient in Microsoft Suite: Word, PowerPoint, Visio, SharePoint; and Adobe Online Help Tools

Required Clearance:
None

Working Environment & Conditions

Onsite

Our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy

Dobbs Defense Solutions is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding), sexual orientation, gender or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), gender expression and transgender status, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, military or veteran status, marital or domestic partner status, genetic information, citizenship, low-income status or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable law. We are committed to equal employment opportunity in all decisions related to employment, promotion, wages, benefits, and all other privileges, terms, and conditions of employment.

job_description:
Major Responsibilities

Level I:
Process accounts payable invoices, including vendors, and purchase orders and collection of lien releases.
Set-up and maintain project files. Work with project staff to keep information current at all times.
Track subcontractors and sub-tiers including insurance certificates, business licenses, federal forms, contract documents.
Provide general contract and subcontract assistance including document generation and processing and interaction with BBRS contract personnel.
Track, audit and process certified payroll and ensure payroll reports meet compliance standards. Work with subcontractors to correct any issues.
Process subcontractor and company site access requests.
Process new hires, field and office, as per Bristol policies and assist with arrangement of physicals and drug testing appointments.
Input timesheets and expense reports as needed to support the field team.
Assist with completion of project closeout including final releases and an internal self-audit to ensure all final documents are complete and open-commitments are satisfied.
Assist with estimating and proposal efforts as needed.
Assist with pre-construction plans as needed.
Perform general filing, mail processing and administrative duties.
Look for ways to improve and promote quality and monitor own work to ensure quality is met.
Perform general clerical duties as needed to support the team including, but not limited to, ordering supplies, answering telephone inquiries, taking messages, filing, scanning and photocopying.

Level 2:
May be responsible for Level 1 Duties and Responsibilities.
Assist PM using established procedures for project invoicing (Accounts Receivable).
Process subcontractor invoices.
Provide general contract and subcontract administration.

Prepare routine teaming agreements, subcontracts, change orders, purchase orders, and other subcontractor or job related actions. Prepare, organize, and maintain subcontract records and files documenting contract performance and compliance. Provide general contract and subcontract administration.
Generate, review and maintain documents and records pertaining to all aspects of contracting process including pre-award and post award correspondence, task orders, mods, closeout records, amendments, cost estimates, and delivery orders.
Understand contract requirements, special provisions, and terms and conditions to ensure compliance with appropriate laws, regulations, corporate policies, and business unit procedures.
Oversee certified payroll submissions to ensure compliance with federal and client requirements.
Coordinate with client any site access requirements, ensure company and subcontractor compliance.
Complete project closeout including final releases, final billing, and an internal self-audit to ensure all final documents are complete and open-commitments are satisfied.

Analyst:
May be responsible for Level 1 & 2 Duties and Responsibilities.
Analyze contract requirements, special provisions, and terms and conditions to ensure compliance with appropriate laws, regulations, corporate policies, and business unit procedures.
Monitor open commitments utilizing cost and accounting data to ensure subcontractor/purchase order funding is aligned with expenditures and project budget. Examine and review contract reporting deliverables to ensure compliance with contract requirements.
Work with General Manager coordinating estimated costs to complete for department projects. Meet with PM’s monthly to review project status and cost accounting, provide cost reporting, coordinate submission of invoices/accruals in a timely manner to capture costs, investigation and reporting of job and department related costs.
Assist with performance measurement and associated cost trending. Prepare and assist in various levels of project cost analysis and reporting. Participate in project cost review meetings.
Perform research, provide audit support, resolve routine contractual issues, and contract closeout.
Minimum Education/Experience

High School Diploma or equivalent, Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration preferred.

Level 1: Minimum of one year recent experience as a Project Assistant or Administrative Assistant;

Level 2: two years recent experience as a Construction or Environmental Project Assistant or Administrative Assistant with Construction or Environmental project duties; Analyst: five years recent experience as a Construction or Environmental Project Administrator or Administrative Assistant with Construction or Environmental project duties.

Required Knowledge or Skills

Level 1:
Ability to manage own activities on a day to day basis.
Ability to prioritize and organize, work well under stress, meet deadlines. Work independently, prioritize work activities and use time efficiently.
Ability to be flexible and adapt to constant change.
Ability to work flexible hours as required to meet deadlines.
Strong interpersonal skills to assist and communicate with staff and clients.
Strong computer skills including proficiency in Microsoft (MS) Excel, MS Word, MS Outlook, Adobe Acrobat and accounting software.
Ability to maintain confidentiality on a wide variety of topics and issues requiring discretion.
Ability to perform tasks in a safe and responsible manner.
Ability to respond appropriately and professionally to all inquiries or complaints
Knowledge of basic accounts payable and account receivable requirements.
Knowledge of compliance requirements including company, state and federal requirements.
Knowledge of business line workflow principles and company processes and procedures.
Ability to work as part of a project team as well as be an integral part of the company PA Team. Demonstrate and promote a positive team-oriented environment.
Demonstrates a high level of accuracy in preparing and entering financial information.
Knowledge of administrative and clerical procedures and systems such as managing files and records, and other office procedures and terminology.
Knowledge of project management terminology.
Ability to clearly speak, write, read and understand the English language.

Level 2:
All Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs) of Level 1.
Ability to gather and analyze data, reason logically and creatively, draw conclusions and apply to project.
Ability to think innovatively and proactively to solve problems in a positive manner.
Ability to embrace change.
Exceptional computer skills including proficiency in MS Excel, MS Word, MS Outlook, Adobe Acrobat and accounting software.
Sound judgment and decision making skills.
Ability to exercise sound professional judgment and maintain confidentiality on a wide variety of topics and issues requiring discretion.
Ability to take charge when necessary and evaluate situations to determine the proper course of action.

Analyst:
All KSAs of Level 1 & 2.
Ability to function in a self-directed, fast-paced, agile environment using critical thinking and strong problem solving skills.
Skilled at problem analysis and resolution.
Ability to recognize financial impact of project actions.
Knowledge of financial and project management terminology.
Ability to analyze financial and project data to identify key issues.
Ability to gather and analyze data, reason logically and creatively, draw conclusions and make appropriate recommendations.
Preferred Knowledge or Skills

Project Administrator, Office Manager or Assistant Project Manager within the specific business line, preferably in the Federal Contracting market.

Measures for Performance

Current/updated job files

Complete files including fully executed contract documents

Timely submission of compliance required documents

Timely processing of AP for timely payments and compliance with pay when paid requirements

Demonstration of working as part of a team

Physical Demands
Sedentary to light physical workload.
Employee must be able to exert up to 20 pounds of force occasionally and/or up to a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body.
Required to have close visual acuity to perform activities such as viewing a computer terminal and extensive reading. Also may be required to have visual acuity to operate motor vehicles.
Specific physical requirements include, but are not limited to, lifting, grasping, talking, hearing and performing repetitive motions.
The worker is not subject to adverse environmental conditions.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Benefits

Excellent salary and benefit package to include: paid time off, paid holidays, comprehensive health insurance plan including medical, dental, and vision, life insurance, long term disability insurance; 401(k) plan with employer match.

EEO Statement

Bristol companies are equal opportunity employers and offer any available positions to all, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, parenthood, pregnancy, marital status or changes in marital status, in accordance with applicable state and federal laws. This applies to recruitment, placement, pay, benefits, training, employment status changes, social and recreational programs, and other conditions and benefits of employment. As an Alaska-Native owned company, Bristol companies seek out and hire qualified Alaska Natives and other minorities.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

job_description:
Community Action Partnership of San Luis Obispo County,Inc. Helping People. Changing Lives. CAPSLO Mission, Vision and Core Values CAPSLO has a vaccination policy for employees.

If you are hired, we will require you to prove that you have received the COVID-19 vaccine or have a valid religious or medical reason not to be vaccinated. Position Summary: Under general direction, it provides administrative and clerical support to the Family and Community Support Services Positive Opportunities for Parenting Success (POPS2) program and the San Luis Obispo Family Resource Center (SLO FRC). This position supports CAPSLO’s mission by providing support to the Family and Community Support Services staff, who work with clients and help them achieve self-sufficiency. Required Education and Experience: Must have a High school diploma/GED and five years of experience in office management and clerical duties or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Must have strong Microsoft Excel skills and experience creating spreadsheets and tracking data. Preferred Education and Experience: Bilingual, biliterate, and bicultural preferred. Essential Functions: Provides administrative and data support to both the POPS2 and SLO FRC programs. Helps ensure that programs are following curriculum guidelines and quality data is being captured.

Responsibilities and Duties: Specific to POPS2: 1. Provides support to the POP2 team. Works closely with the Lead Case Manager and Parent Educator/Advocate Coordinator in ensuring the program is operating smoothly. 2.

Performs a variety of clerical tasks, including but not limited to, word processing, data entry, filing, copying, computing, mailing, and tracking information, etc. 3. Screens and directs telephone calls to the POPS2 team. 4.

Maintains supplies and reorders as needed. 5. Vouches and tracks all bills related to the program. 6.

Enters intakes and programmatic file information into ClientTrack, the agency’s client database system. Creates additional spreadsheets, as needed, to track programmatic data. Maintains the spreadsheets and assists with creating reports as needed. 7.

Assist the Lead Case Manager in coordinating the groups and ensuring all required materials are needed. 8. Maintains organized client files and completes follow-up surveys to gauge family improvements due to the program. 9.

Assists with preparation of letters, brochures, bulletins, announcements, and flyers. 10. Picks up and distributes mail, packages, and correspondence. 11.

Provides logistical arrangements for meetings and activities, develops agendas and prepares meeting materials. 12. Compiles and records statistical data, and transfers those numbers into readable and comprehensive reports. 13.

Helps to maintain general office space in an orderly and clean manner. 14. Maintains a current knowledge of: CAPSLO Programs, organizational structure, policies and procedures, etc. 15.

Attends staff meetings, conferences and workshops as required. 16. Distributes information, letters, and memos to all program management and POPS2 staff. 17.

Performs other duties as assigned. Specific to the San Luis Obispo Family Resource Center (SLO FRC): 1. Provides support to the SLO FRC team. Works closely with the family advocates and SLO FRC Supervisor in ensuring the program is operating smoothly.

2. Receives intakes from the family advocates and inputs them into the agency’s client database, ClientTrack. 3. Keeps up to date on the clients being served and captures all outcomes in ClientTrack and exits them when they close out.

4. Has access to the Aries school database and assists with tracking data into the database. 5. Supports the FRC Supervisor and the TAPP Youth Advocate with the Teen Task Force, such as, coordinating meetings, maintaining the attendee email list, etc.

6. Supports the family advocates with support, including but not limited to getting client signatures, completing intakes, dropping off goods, etc. 7. Supports SLO FRC staff with preparation of the SAFE Intensive Meetings.

8. Assists in compiling and completing reports, including monthly board reports. General to Both Programs: 1. Must be dedicated to the goals and philosophy of the division’s child development programs and CAPSLO.

2. Must use reasonable precautions in the performance of one’s duties and adhere to all applicable safety rules and practices, and act in such a manner as to assure at all times maximum safety to one’s self, fellow employees, clients and children. 3. Performs other duties as needed.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Knowledge 1. Must have demonstrated knowledge of local human services. 2. Must be computer literate with basic knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and data tracking programs.

Skills 1. Must have strong verbal and written communication skills. 2. Must have demonstrated organizational skills in former positions.

3. Must be detail oriented and be able to develop reports, and compile statistics. Abilities 1. Must be able to coordinate information processing in a responsible and confidential manner.

2. Must have the demonstrated ability to motivate and problem solve in former positions. 3. Must have the ability to show warmth and appreciation of human growth at all levels and understand the process of gaining trust and credibility with any population.

4. Must be able to develop and maintain effective work relationships with other employees and representatives of private and public agencies. 5. Must be able to relate well to all people of the community regardless of color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, age, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, disability or socio-economic level.

6. Must be self-motivated and able to work independently and with minimal supervision. 7. Must be able to work under pressure of many deadlines and difficult situations.

8. Must understand, uphold, and continue working toward accomplishing the mission, strategic goals and performance measures of the agency. Supervisory Responsibility: This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities. Work Environment: Requires working indoors in a temperature-controlled environment with some exposure to copier and printer chemicals/fumes.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Physical 1. Position requires intermittent sitting, standing, walking, twisting, and bending. 2.

Must be able to lift 30 pounds. 3. Simple grasping and hand manipulation required, as well as reaching above and below shoulder level. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work: Full Time, 40 hours/week Travel: Some travel may be required to attend meetings, conferences, and training.

License & Certifications: 1. Must have dependable, insured transportation, and a valid California Driver’s License (mileage to be reimbursed) and acceptable driving record. A DMV printout and proof of insurance will be required. Additional Eligibility Qualifications: 1.

Must be at least 18 years of age by date of hire. 2. Must comply with the CAPSLO COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, either being fully vaccinated or have an approved exemption. 3.

Based on the program, a current TB skin test/Chest X-Ray may be required. 4. Employment is contingent upon meeting all applicable job requirements and background requirements. A criminal history clearance is required prior to employment.

5. Upon hire, agency staff will check Megan’s Law (or the current sexual predator website) to ensure each staff being hired is clear for employment. Agency staff will check the website annually to ensure all program staff are cleared to work. Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.

Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Reasonable Accommodations: I have read and understand the Essential Functions of this position, including the Responsibilities and Duties. I also acknowledge that the Responsibilities and Duties for this position may change in the future with or without prior notice. I further understand that I can request a reasonable accommodation, should one be necessary for me to carry out the Essential Functions of this position.

I can perform these with or without reasonable accommodation. Compensation and Benefits Package Medical, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending Plan CAPSLO offers benefits through a group medical, dental, vision, flexible spending account, life and AD&D insurance program. CAPSLO pays the full amount (100%) of the premiums to cover full-time employees, and half (50%) of the premiums to cover eligible part-time employees. Eligible employees may elect, at their own cost, to have medical, dental and vision insurance coverage for their dependents.

Additionally, CAPSLO offers a Long Term Disability ("LTD") insurance program for eligible employees. Retirement Savings Plan CAPSLO offers eligible employees the opportunity to contribute a portion of their earnings to a Section 403(b) Retirement Plan. Employees are 100% vested upon enrollment into the plan. CAPSLO matches 60% of every dollar contributed up to an annual maximum of 15% of your annual salary (not to exceed IRS limits) after 6 months of employment.

Holidays Twelve paid holidays during the course of the each calendar year. Employees also receive one extra workday off with pay as a "Personal Holiday." Vacation/Sick Leave CAPSLO awards 80-160 hours of vacation annually with a maximum accrual of 320 hours, depending on years of service. Paid Sick time is accrued at 8 hours per month (based on weekly hours) with a maximum accrual of 280 hours. CAPSLO also offers the opportunity to convert unused sick time to vacation and a vacation cash out for eligible employees once a year.

Additional Benefits CAPSLO offers additional benefits including employee assistance program (EAP), reduced rates for pet insurance, reduced rates for cellular phone service, reduced rates for car rentals, and additional time off for positions classified as exempt, and workers’ compensation insurance. For questions regarding the application process or open positions, contact the Recruiting Department at 805-544-4355 or email recruitment@capslo.org. EOE/ V/ ADA/ Drug Free Workplace/ Asset Infused Organization. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, religion, national origin, veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

job_description:
Arlluk Technology Solutions, LLC, a Koniag Government Services company, is looking for an experienced individual to perform the duties of a SME Computer Systems Analyst to support ATS and our government customer in Washington, DC. This is a remote opportunity.

We offer highly competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, three weeks paid time off, and more.

Position Overview:
The Subject Matter Expert (SME) Computer Systems Analyst is an integral component of a team supporting a federal client’s vision to achieve operational excellence by maintaining a mission critical system that is needed to transmit vital Federal client Department financial data to other Federal agencies. To support ongoing Operations and Maintenance (O&M) technical and functional support services and provide ongoing support to ensure there is a continuous reconciliation between Oracle Federal Financials and central accounting and Program systems.

The SME provides technical/management leadership on major tasks or technology assignments. Establishes goals and plans that meet project objectives. Has domain and expert technical knowledge. Directs and controls activities for a client, having overall responsibility for financial management, methods, and staffing to ensure that technical requirements are met. Interactions involve client negotiations and interfacing with senior management. Decision making and domain knowledge may have a critical impact on overall project implementation. May supervise others. Analyze science, engineering, business, and other data processing problems to implement and improve computer systems. Analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate r improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations. May analyze or recommend commercially available software.

Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:
Provide technical/management leadership on major tasks or technology assignments.
Establish goals and plans that meet project objectives
Meet and coordinate with stakeholders to establish project scope, system goals and requirements
Translate technical specifications into clear non-technical requirements
Directs and controls activities for a client, having overall responsibility for financial management, methods, and staffing to ensure that technical requirements are met
Interactions involve client negotiations and interfacing with senior management
Provide decision making and domain knowledge on overall project implementation
Analyze science, engineering, business, and other data processing problems to implement and improve computer systems
Analyze user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations
Develop project plans and manage projects from initiating to execution and closing
Prepare and maintain all project documentations
Provide and revise documentation per changes to systems and operational needs
Monitor systems and provide performance status reports
Gather and analyze data, interpret the data and its relationship to workflows and identify patterns and trends
Create and present on reports as needed by the business
Analyze and recommend software solutions
Collaborate with developers to implement requirements and provide necessary guidance during quality assurance process
Find creative solutions to complex problems
May supervise others and/or work in a team environment
Ensure a positive and professional Federal client service experience
Required Knowledge, Skills and Experience
5+ years working experience as a Computer Systems Analyst
5+ years Oracle database experience
Proficiency in SQL programming
Strong understanding and knowledge of the principles and practices associated with database maintenance and administration
Experience in data modeling, database schema, database relationships, and ER diagrams
Experience and knowledge in financial management
Experience with reporting and Business Intelligence tools
Strong technical and analytical skills
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent critical thinker and have superior communication skills both written and verbal
Experience working in an Agile development environment
Exceptional problem-solving skills
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Strong presentation skills
Proven ability to assess business needs and translate them into relevant solutions
Working knowledge of a wide variety of common programming languages (e.g., Java, Python, C/C++)
Experience in developing and providing IT and end user training on computer hardware and/or application software
Experience in leading a team or working in a team-oriented environment
Experience with Federal consulting
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, IT, or related

Working Environment & Conditions
This job operates in a professional office environment and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. This position is primarily indoors, consistent with a standard office position and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. The incumbent is required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. The workload may require the incumbent to sit for extended periods of time. The incumbent must be able to read, do simple math calculations and withstand moderate amounts of stress. The incumbent must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy
The company is an equal opportunity employer. The company shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), national origin, age, disability, military/veteran status, marital status, genetic information, or any other factor protected by law. We are committed to equal employment opportunity in all decisions related to employment, promotion, wages, benefits and all other privileges, terms, and conditions of employment.

The company is dedicated to seeking all qualified applicants. If you require an accommodation to navigate or to apply to a position on our website, please contact Heaven Wood via e-mail at accommodations@koniag-gs.com or by calling 703-488-9377 to request accommodations.

Koniag Government Services (KGS) is an Alaska Native Owned corporation supporting the values and traditions of our native communities through an agile employee and corporate culture that delivers Enterprise Solutions, Professional Services and Operational Management to Federal Government Agencies. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Koniag, we apply our proven commercial solutions to a deep knowledge of Defense and Civilian missions to provide forward leaning technical, professional, and operational solutions. KGS enables successful mission outcomes for our customers through solution-oriented business partnerships and a commitment to exceptional service delivery. We ensure long-term success with a continuous improvement approach while balancing the collective interests of our customers, employees, and native communities. For more information, please visit www.koniag-gs.com

job_description:
Summary
We are looking for a motivated self-starter to join our team as a Quality Control Tester/Business Analyst. You’ll be working with our QA/Development team to ensure quality development releases and with our business team to ensure that our customers are using Spyglass successfully. It would be helpful to have background knowledge in HIPAA formats (837, 834, etc.), although this is not a requirement. The best candidate will be a team player who is enthusiastic and loves to learn!

Business Analyst Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or higher
Experience working with the software development life cycle
Enthusiasm for learning new things and a willingness to become a subject matter expert in Spyglass
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)

Business Analyst Responsibilities:
Perform manual testing of changes the development team makes to the application. This includes developing test plans and documenting results
Write clear, concise release notes explaining the nature of enhancements and other changes made to the application
Assist with maintaining the user-facing documentation
Use problem-solving and investigative skills to troubleshoot issues and brainstorm solutions
Assist with other business tasks as needed, including training end users, performing demonstrations of the software, and loading data
Read through trading partner documents and HIPAA specifications to create simple requirements for developers to follow
Regular and predictable attendance is an essential function of this job
Work Schedule
Full time. Monday – Friday 8:30am - 5:00pm. Flexible schedules available with the potential to work from home occasionally after 90 days!

Competitive Benefits & Compensation Package
Paid Time Off (PTO)
15 days of PTO during the next calendar year!
Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance
Company paid short term disability, long term disability, and AD&D insurance
401k with employer match
Tuition reimbursement program
Career development opportunities
Referral bonus for all full-time referrals
Competitive wages
Annual opportunities for increases and bonuses
Pay
Pay commensurate with education and experience

Our Culture
BeneSys wants to be a great service provider to the members we serve, and we recognize we can only do that if we are also a great employer with successful employees. In short, our success is driven by our employees successes. We want to be a place where people want to work, feel proud of what they do and feel fulfilled both professionally and personally. We want to create a place where employees can find long-term growth and potential.

Our culture focuses on three core values:
Collaboration: working together across 31 locations to achieve the best for the company and our clients
Dedication: striving to create an environment where all employees work toward a common goal while committing to providing the best customer service to our members and our colleagues
Integrity: doing what we say we will do. Upholding strong ethical and moral principles
ADA & EEO

Reasonable accommodations will be made so that qualified individuals with disabilities are able to complete the application process and, if hired, fulfill the essential functions of their job.

job_description:
Become an Assembler! Assembly is looking for a motivated problem solver who will integrate with multiple divisions to identify automation workflow opportunities. Our Automation Specialist will work closely with various stakeholders to implement solutions. Joining the Assembly team means you will help our clients evolve and adapt to the rapidly changing healthcare environment and optimize existing business operations, improve clinical outcomes, create a consumer-centric healthcare experience, and drive physician, patient, and employee engagement across the enterprise.

If you are looking for a company that is focused on being the best in the industry, love being challenged, and make a direct impact on our business, then look no further! We are adding to our motivated team of Assemblers that pride themselves on their strong critical thinking skills, dedication, team focused mentality, and our “can-do/go-getter” attitude.

What you will do
Support multiple project workstreams while utilizing company approaches, methodologies, and tools to implement and optimize innovative solutions that address business and stakeholder needs.
Create and utilize workplans to effectively prioritize and manage various tasks with high urgency across multiple divisions.
Coordinate tasks with key IT Administrators, Operational Leaders, and vendors as necessary while managing the overall project.
Stabilize current workflows, standardize processes, and develop a strategy around automating these workflows.
Transition manual workflows onto automated platforms and conduct all necessary testing.
Apply proven methodologies and best practices to unique Revenue Cycle Management scenarios.
Collaborate with project team members and client stakeholders to design and implement effective solutions to complex business problems.
Detect data gaps and risks and develop comprehensive solutions.
Identify areas of improvement to data collections, documentation, workflow, integration, and technology management by taking initiative and utilizing effective problem-solving skills
Own new projects as needed and assigned.

What it takes to join the family
Software project experience
Strong experience in Microsoft Office 365. Additional database knowledge is a plus.
Five to ten years of experience as a Business Analyst with an emphasis on automation and workflow optimization. RPA familiarity is a plus.
Healthcare industry and Revenue Cycle Management processes experience preferred.
Project Management tool experience including Asana, Monday.com, or similar tool experience.
Experience mapping complex processes using Visio, LucidChart, or similar tools
Lean / Six Sigma training or certification preferred.
Exceptional leadership skills, organizational skills, high attention to detail, with the ability to handle complex, ambiguous problems, workflows, and situations.
Analytical mindset with a problem-solving aptitude.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with customer service focused aptitude.
Sharing our core belief system of Honesty, Candor, and Trust is table stakes for joining the family.
Adaptable to change and willingness to learn different processes—we are Assemblers, after all!

Why Assembly?
Be part of something special—we are in high growth mode through organic growth and Acquisition.
Career growth-your next role with Assembly might not be created yet—we are waiting for you to help us chart the way!
Robust ongoing training and development programs.
Competitive Benefit Packages, Paid Holidays, and Paid Time off to enjoy your time away from the office.
Located in the heart of the West Loop—across from Ogilvie and the Clinton “L” station—Starbucks, Dunkin, and the French Market at your doorstep.

In conjunction with our suite of companies, Assembly™ provides an array of tech-enabled products and services including Revenue Cycle Acceleration™, marketing, logistics and compliance that help long term care communities and physician practices perform at their best. Chevo is hiring an experienced Data Analyst-Federal Programs to join our expanding firm. This position will provide the opportunity for significant client interaction by learning the client’s business and becoming a trusted advisor. Ideal candidates will demonstrate versatility in understanding and performing work related to Data Analytics as it relates to federal program analysis and information sharing. This position is in Washington, DC, and metro accessible. At the appropriate time, this position may be located on-site with the client in Washington, DC.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Support research, analysis, and development of written products for information and guidance related to data and information sharing initiatives.
Assist the client program staff with the development of concrete and demonstrable metrics and measures of program outputs and outcomes.
Document the processes and workflows for measurement activities supporting program implementation.
Work as part of a team to document dashboarding and reporting requirements.
Ability to interface with senior business decision-makers in a professional manner to understand their requirements and analyze these requirements to plan, execute, and manage the delivery of Business Intelligence capabilities.
Engage in performing, data calls, data analysis and business intelligence
Develop program communications to stakeholders and supports executive level briefings.
Ability to validate adherence to specified criteria or standards regarding data integrity.

3+ years of experience
BA/BS equivalent
Strong business analysis and writing skills
Demonstrated ability to work with a variety of stakeholder groups to solicit requirements
Previous experience developing program performance measurements
Strong Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, and Reporting background
